analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / yang bdag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku blta pa'am /

analyzed: rtog pa de dag thams cad ni sangs rgyas kyi mthu'o snyam bgyid do //
translated: is due to the power of the Buddha.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

original: dra ba can gyi 'od /
analyzed: dra ba can gyi 'od /

analyzed: ji skad zer ba de bzhin te /

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: dra bcan gyi 'od /
analyzed: dra bcan gyi 'od /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la rab tu zhi ba'i rnam par bkad pa zhes bya ba'i 'od zer yod de /

original: dra ba can gyi 'od /
analyzed: dra ba can gyi 'od /
translated: “Jālinīprabha,

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la mi 'jigs pa spobs pa zhes bya ba'i 'od @37a *// zer yod de /

analyzed: 'od zer des reg pa'i sems can rnams de bzhin gshegs pa la kun 'dri zhing phyir 'dri bar byed do //
translated: Sentient beings who are touched by that light ray ask the Tathāgata questions and counter-questions.

original: dra ba can gyi 'od /
analyzed: dra ba can gyi 'od /
translated: “Jālinīprabha,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa zhes bya ba'i 'od zer yod de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa zhes bya ba'i 'od zer yod de /
translated: the Tathāgata has a light ray called ‘accumulated roots of virtue.’

analyzed: 'od zer des reg pa'i sems can rnams 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po'i rgyal srid thob par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa la kun 'dri'o //
translated: Sentient beings who are touched by that light ray ask the Tathāgata questions in order to attain the kingdom of a universal monarch.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: In the same way,

original: 'od zer dge ba'i rnam par bkod pa zhes bya ba'i 'od zer des reg pa'i sems can rnams brgya byin thob par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa la kun 'dra'o //
analyzed: 'od zer dge ba'i rnam par bkod pa zhes bya ba'i 'od zer des reg pa'i sems can rnams brgya byin thob par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa la kun 'dra'o //
translated: the sentient beings who are touched by the light ray called “array of virtuous light rays” ask the Tathāgata about the means of attaining Śakra.

original: 'od zer bdag po thob pa zhes bya ba'i 'od zer des reg pa'i sems can rnams tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skye bar bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa la kun 'dri'o //
analyzed: 'od zer bdag po thob pa zhes bya ba'i 'od zer des reg pa'i sems can rnams tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skye bar bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa la kun 'dri'o //
translated: The sentient beings who are touched by the light ray called “attaining the state of a lord” ask the Tathāgata about being reborn in the world of Brahmā.

original: 'od zer nyon mongs pa med par gyur pa zhes bya ba'i 'od zer des reg pa'i sems can rnams de bzhin gshegs pa la nyan thos kyi theg pa kun 'dri'o //
analyzed: 'od zer nyon mongs pa med par gyur pa zhes bya ba'i 'od zer des reg pa'i sems can rnams de bzhin gshegs pa la nyan thos kyi theg pa kun 'dri'o //
translated: The sentient beings who are touched by the light ray called “becoming free of afflictions” ask the Tathāgata about the Śrāvaka Vehicle.

original: 'od zer rtse gcig pa dben pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i 'od zer des reg pa'i sems can rnams de bzhin gshegs pa la rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa kun 'dra'o //
analyzed: 'od zer rtse gcig pa dben pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i 'od zer des reg pa'i sems can rnams de bzhin gshegs pa la rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa kun 'dra'o //
translated: The sentient beings who are touched by the light ray called “single-pointed, endowed with solitude” ask the Tathāgata about the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle.

original: 'od zer thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes su dbang bskur ba thob pa zhes bya ba'i 'od zer des reg pa'i sems can rnams de bzhin @37b gshegs pa la theg pa chen po sangs rgyas kyi theg pa kun 'dri'o //🔽'od zer khyad par du 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i 'od zer des de bzhin gshegs pa byon pa'am /
analyzed: 'od zer thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes su dbang bskur ba thob pa zhes bya ba'i 'od zer des reg pa'i sems can rnams de bzhin @37b gshegs pa la theg pa chen po sangs rgyas kyi theg pa kun 'dri'o // 'od zer khyad par du 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i 'od zer des de bzhin gshegs pa byon pa'am /
translated: The light rays called “attaining the empowerment of all light rays into the wisdom of omniscience” cause sentient beings who are touched by those light rays to ask the Tathāgatas about the Great Vehicle, the Buddha Vehicle.

original: bzhud pa'i zhabs kyi mthil gyis sems can gang la reg pa de dag shi 'phos ma thag tu bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du skye'o //
analyzed: bzhud pa'i zhabs kyi mthil gyis sems can gang la reg pa de dag shi 'phos ma thag tu bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du skye'o //
translated: The light rays called “going forth” cause sentient beings who are touched by the soles of the feet of the Tathāgatas, whether they are coming or going, to be reborn in the happy realms of the higher worlds as soon as they die.

original: rgyan thams cad bkod pa zhes bya ba'i 'od zer de /
analyzed: rgyan thams cad bkod pa zhes bya ba'i 'od zer de /
translated: The light rays called “array of all ornaments”🔽are emitted

original: de bzhin gshegs pa grong du gshegs pa na 'byin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa grong du gshegs pa na 'byin te /
translated: when the Tathāgatas enter a town.

original: der de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od des sems can su dag la reg pa de dag thams cad bde ba'i mchog dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od des sems can su dag la reg pa de dag thams cad bde ba'i mchog dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those sentient beings who are touched by the Tathāgatas’ light there will all be endowed with the highest bliss.

original: rgyan thams cad bkod pa'ang grong khyer der 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyan thams cad bkod pa'ang grong khyer der 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The array of all ornaments will also appear in that town.

analyzed: rnam par 'thor ba zhes bya ba'i 'od zer des ni de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas mu med du rab tu g-yo bar byed do //
translated: The ray called “Scatterer” causes the Tathagatas to shake infinite world systems.

original: bde ba ston pa zhes bya ba'i 'od zer des ni sems can dmyal ba pa'i sems can rnams kyi sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal med par byed do //
analyzed: bde ba ston pa zhes bya ba'i 'od zer des ni sems can dmyal ba pa'i sems can rnams kyi sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal med par byed do //
translated: The ray called “Revealer of Happiness” removes the suffering of the hells from beings in the hells.

original: 'od zer byams pas 'phags pa zhes bya ba des ni byol song gi skye gnas su song ba'i sems can rnams gcig la gcig mi za bar byed do //
analyzed: 'od zer byams pas 'phags pa zhes bya ba des ni byol song gi skye gnas su song ba'i sems can rnams gcig la gcig mi za bar byed do //
translated: The ray called “Noble Love” causes the animals to stop eating each other.

original: 'od zer rab tu sim par byed pa zhes bya ba des ni gshin rje'i 'jig rten pa'i sems can rnams kyi gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi sdug bsngal med par byed do //
analyzed: 'od zer rab tu sim par byed pa zhes bya ba des ni gshin rje'i 'jig rten pa'i sems can rnams kyi gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi sdug bsngal med par byed do //
translated: The ray called “Satisfier” removes the suffering of the world of Yama from beings in the world of Yama.

original: dri ma med pa zhes bya ba'i 'od zer des ni sems can ldongs pa rnams mig @38a *//🔽thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dri ma med pa zhes bya ba'i 'od zer des ni sems can ldongs pa rnams mig @38a *//🔽thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The ray called “Stainless” causes the blind to gain sight.

original: rna ba'i rjes su mthun pa zhes bya ba'i 'od zer des ni sems can 'on pa rnams rna ba thob par 'gyur ro //🔽rnam par spong ba zhes bya ba'i 'od zer des ni sems can mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la gnas pa rnams /
analyzed: rna ba'i rjes su mthun pa zhes bya ba'i 'od zer des ni sems can 'on pa rnams rna ba thob par 'gyur ro // rnam par spong ba zhes bya ba'i 'od zer des ni sems can mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la gnas pa rnams /
translated: The ray called “in accordance with the ear” causes sentient beings who are deaf to obtain the ear.

original: dge bcu'i las kyi lam thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge bcu'i las kyi lam thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The ray called “abandonment” causes sentient beings who are engaged in the ten unwholesome courses of action to obtain the ten wholesome courses of action.

original: ngo tshe shes pa zhes bya ba'i 'od zer des ni sems can myos pa rnams dran pa 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngo tshe shes pa zhes bya ba'i 'od zer des ni sems can myos pa rnams dran pa 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The ray called “shame” causes sentient beings who are intoxicated to obtain mindfulness.

original: med par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i 'od zer des ni sems can log par lta ba can rnams yang dag par lta ba thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: med par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i 'od zer des ni sems can log par lta ba can rnams yang dag par lta ba thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The ray called “non-existence” causes sentient beings who have wrong views to obtain the right view.

original: rab tu gtong ba zhes bya ba'i 'od zer des ni sems can ser sna can rnams gtong ba thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab tu gtong ba zhes bya ba'i 'od zer des ni sems can ser sna can rnams gtong ba thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The ray called “generosity” causes sentient beings who are stingy to obtain generosity.

original: yongs su gdung ba med pa zhes bya ba'i 'od zer des ni sems can ngan pa'i ngang tshul can rnams tshul khrims thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yongs su gdung ba med pa zhes bya ba'i 'od zer des ni sems can ngan pa'i ngang tshul can rnams tshul khrims thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The ray called “non-affliction” causes sentient beings who have bad moral discipline to obtain moral discipline.

original: phan pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i 'od zer des ni sems can gnod par sems pa rnams bzod pa dang / des pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phan pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i 'od zer des ni sems can gnod par sems pa rnams bzod pa dang / des pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The light ray called “beneficial” causes sentient beings who are malicious to attain patience and gentleness.

original: 'bar ba can zhes bya ba'i 'od zer des ni sems can le lo can rnams brtson 'grus thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bar ba can zhes bya ba'i 'od zer des ni sems can le lo can rnams brtson 'grus thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The light ray called “blazing” causes sentient beings who are lazy to attain perseverance.

original: rtse gcig pa zhes bya ba'i 'od zer des ni sems can dran pa nyams pa rnams bsam gtan thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtse gcig pa zhes bya ba'i 'od zer des ni sems can dran pa nyams pa rnams bsam gtan thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The light ray called “one-pointed” causes sentient beings who are forgetful to attain concentration.

original: ye shes zhes bya ba'i 'od zer des ni sems can 'chal ba'i shes rab can rnams shes rab @38b thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ye shes zhes bya ba'i 'od zer des ni sems can 'chal ba'i shes rab can rnams shes rab @38b thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The light ray called “wisdom” causes sentient beings who are unwise to attain wisdom.

original: rnyog pa med pa zhes bya ba'i 'od zer des ni sems can ma dad pa rnams dad pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnyog pa med pa zhes bya ba'i 'od zer des ni sems can ma dad pa rnams dad pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The light ray called “unpolluted” causes sentient beings who are faithless to attain faith.

original: kun 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i 'od zer des ni sems can thos pa nyung ba rnams thos pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i 'od zer des ni sems can thos pa nyung ba rnams thos pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The light ray called “retention” causes sentient beings who have little learning to attain learning.

original: spyod pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i 'od zer des ni sems can ngo tsha ba dang / 'dzem pa med pa rnams ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa thob par 'gyur ro //🔽skyo ba zhes bya ba'i 'od zer des ni sems can 'dod chags spyod pa rnams kyi 'dod chags 'joms par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spyod pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i 'od zer des ni sems can ngo tsha ba dang / 'dzem pa med pa rnams ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa thob par 'gyur ro // skyo ba zhes bya ba'i 'od zer des ni sems can 'dod chags spyod pa rnams kyi 'dod chags 'joms par 'gyur ro //
translated: The ray called “endowed with conduct” causes those beings who are without shame and modesty to attain shame and modesty.🔽The ray called “disillusioned” destroys the desire of those beings who engage in desire.

original: dga' ba zhes bya ba'i 'od zer des ni sems can zhe sdang spyod pa rnams kyi zhe sdang 'joms par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dga' ba zhes bya ba'i 'od zer des ni sems can zhe sdang spyod pa rnams kyi zhe sdang 'joms par 'gyur ro //
translated: The ray called “joyful” destroys the hatred of those beings who engage in hatred.

original: snang ba can zhes bya ba'i 'od zer des ni sems can gti mug spyod pa rnams rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snang ba can zhes bya ba'i 'od zer des ni sems can gti mug spyod pa rnams rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
translated: The ray called “illuminating” causes those beings who engage in delusion to understand dependent origination.

original: kun tu 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i 'od zer des ni sems can cha mnyam par spyod pa rnams cha mnyam pa spyod pa spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun tu 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i 'od zer des ni sems can cha mnyam par spyod pa rnams cha mnyam pa spyod pa spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The ray called “omnipresent” causes those beings who engage in equal shares to abandon engaging in equal shares.

original: dra ba can gyi 'od /
analyzed: dra ba can gyi 'od /
translated: The ray called “net”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la gzugs thams cad ston pa zhes bya ba'i 'od zer yod de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la gzugs thams cad ston pa zhes bya ba'i 'od zer yod de /
translated: The Tathāgata has a light ray called “showing all forms.”

analyzed: 'od zer des reg pa'i sems can rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku kha dog sna tshogs /
translated: Sentient beings who are touched by that light ray see the Tathāgata’s body as having various colors,

original: kha dog du ma /
analyzed: kha dog du ma /
translated: many colors,

analyzed: kha dog brgya stong du mas lhag par mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: many hundreds of thousands of colors.

original: dra ba can gyi 'od /
analyzed: dra ba can gyi 'od /
translated: Jālinīprabha,

analyzed: ngas de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od zer la brtsams te bskal pa'am /

original: bskal pa las lhag par bshad @39a *//
analyzed: bskal pa las lhag par bshad @39a *//
translated: or more than an eon,

original: kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od zer gyi rnam pa dad ldan pa'i chos bstan pa yongs su zad par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od zer gyi rnam pa dad ldan pa'i chos bstan pa yongs su zad par mi 'gyur te /
translated: the Tathāgata’s light rays and the teaching of the Dharma that is connected with them would not come to an end.

original: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni 'od zer gyi yon tan mtha' yas mu med pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni 'od zer gyi yon tan mtha' yas mu med pa dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: In this way, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One has light rays that have infinite, limitless good qualities.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' dra ba can gyi 'od kyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' dra ba can gyi 'od kyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Having been thus addressed, the Bodhisattva Jālinīprabha said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i bkod pa tshad ma mchis par bstan pa 'di dang / thabs mkhas pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ldan pa'i chos bstan pa ngo mtshar to //
translated: it is wonderful that the Tathāgata has revealed the immeasurable array of the body of the Tathāgata, and has taught the Dharma endowed with inconceivable skillful means.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Lord,

analyzed: 'od zer 'di dag ni bdag gis sngon ma thos te /
translated: I have never before heard of such light rays as these.

analyzed: ji lta ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad pa'i don bdag gis 'tshal ba ltar na /
translated: As far as I can understand the meaning of what the Lord has said,

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Lord,

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang la la 'od zer 'di dag gi ming thos nas dad pa rnyed par 'gyur ba de dag thams cad yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi 'od zer 'di lta bus rab tu snang bar bgyid pa'i mthu dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: all those bodhisattvas who hear the names of these light rays and gain faith in them will all become endowed with the power to illuminate with such light rays of perfect buddhahood.

original: yang bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa 'od zer gang gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzhan gyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams bskul ma thag tu mi mjed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams @39b 'dir mchi bar 'gyur ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' su dag 'dri ba dang /
analyzed: yang bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa 'od zer gang gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzhan gyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams bskul ma thag tu mi mjed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams @39b 'dir mchi bar 'gyur ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' su dag 'dri ba dang /
translated: “Also, Blessed One, please emit the light ray called the bodhisattva-exhorting light ray, which, as soon as it touches the bodhisattvas in other buddha realms, causes them to come to this Sahā world system.🔽The bodhisattvas who have perfected questioning,

original: lung bstan pa dang / bshad pa la mthar phyin pa rnams mchis nas de bzhin gshegs pa la kun zhu zhing bsnyen bkur bgyid pa dang / slar zhu bar 'gyur ba'i 'od zer byang chub sems dpa' bskul ba zhes bgyi ba gtang du gsol /
analyzed: lung bstan pa dang / bshad pa la mthar phyin pa rnams mchis nas de bzhin gshegs pa la kun zhu zhing bsnyen bkur bgyid pa dang / slar zhu bar 'gyur ba'i 'od zer byang chub sems dpa' bskul ba zhes bgyi ba gtang du gsol /
translated: receiving predictions, and explaining will then come to the thus-gone one, ask him questions, and serve him, and then return.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe 'od gang gis 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas mu med par snang bar 'gyur ba'i 'od de lta bu sku las phyung ste /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe 'od gang gis 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas mu med par snang bar 'gyur ba'i 'od de lta bu sku las phyung ste /
translated: Then the Blessed One emitted a light ray from his body that illuminated infinite and limitless world systems.

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams 'od des bskul ma thag tu mi mjed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams 'dir phyin par gyur to //
translated: As soon as the bodhisattvas were roused by that light, they arrived in this Sahā world system.

original: de nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di nas shar phyogs su sangs rgyas kyi zhing brgya stong phrag gangg'a'i klung bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyi bye ma snyed 'das pa na yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams yod de /
analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di nas shar phyogs su sangs rgyas kyi zhing brgya stong phrag gangg'a'i klung bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyi bye ma snyed 'das pa na yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams yod de /
translated: “East of this buddha realm, past as many buddha realms as there are grains of sand in seventy-two Ganges Rivers, there is a world system called Pure.

original: de na zla ba'i 'od ces bya ba de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas da ltar bzhugs la 'tsho zhing gzhes te /
analyzed: de na zla ba'i 'od ces bya ba de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas da ltar bzhugs la 'tsho zhing gzhes te /
translated: There, the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddha Moonlight presently resides and lives.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'ba' zhig la chos kyang 'chad pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing de nas phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshangs pa khyad par sems zhes bya ba de 'od des bskul ma thag tu bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'ba' zhig la chos kyang 'chad pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing de nas phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshangs pa khyad par sems zhes bya ba de 'od des bskul ma thag tu bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa
translated: In that buddha realm, only bodhisattvas are taught the Dharma. There was a bodhisattva mahāsattva named Brahmaviśeṣacintin, an irreversible bodhisattva. As soon as he was roused by that light, he went to the place where the bhagavān, the tathāgata,

original: zla ba'i 'od ga la ba der song ste phyin pa dang / @40a *//
analyzed: zla ba'i 'od ga la ba der song ste phyin pa dang / @40a *//
translated: the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha Candra­sūryapradīpa was.

original: bcom ldan 'das de'i zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal nas /🔽bcom ldan 'das de la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de'i zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal nas / bcom ldan 'das de la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: When he arrived, he bowed his head to the feet of that bhagavān.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said to that bhagavān, ‘Bhagavān,

original: 'jig rten du snang ba chen po 'di byung ba'i rgyu gang lags /
analyzed: 'jig rten du snang ba chen po 'di byung ba'i rgyu gang lags /
translated: what is the cause of this great light that has appeared in the world?

original: rkyen gang lags /
analyzed: rkyen gang lags /
translated: What is the condition?’

original: bcom ldan 'das des 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das des 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: That bhagavān said, ‘Noble son,

original: tshangs pa / sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di nas nub phyogs na sangs rgyas kyi zhing brgya stong phrag gangg'a'i klung bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyi bye ma snyed 'das pa na mi mjed ces bya ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams yod de /
analyzed: tshangs pa / sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di nas nub phyogs na sangs rgyas kyi zhing brgya stong phrag gangg'a'i klung bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyi bye ma snyed 'das pa na mi mjed ces bya ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams yod de /
translated: Brahma, to the west of this buddha-field, past buddha-fields as numerous as the sands of seventy-two Ganges Rivers, there is a world-realm called Endurance.

original: de na sh'akya thub pa zhes bya ba de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas da ltar bzhugs te 'tsho zhing gzhes la chos kyang ston to //
analyzed: de na sh'akya thub pa zhes bya ba de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas da ltar bzhugs te 'tsho zhing gzhes la chos kyang ston to //
translated: There dwells a thus-gone one, a worthy one, a perfect buddha called Śākyamuni. He is alive and well, and he teaches the Dharma.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa des /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa des / 'di lta ste /
translated: That thus-gone one🔽has emitted this light from his body

original: phyogs bcu'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams bsdu ba'i phyir sku las 'od 'di btang ngo //🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshangs pa khyad par sems kyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams bsdu ba'i phyir sku las 'od 'di btang ngo // de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshangs pa khyad par sems kyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: in order to gather the bodhisattvas from the ten directions.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Then Brahma Viśeṣacintin said to the Blessed One, Blessed One,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de bdag gzigs par bzhed na mi mjed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams der bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa de la lta ba dang / phyag 'tshal ba dang / bsnyen bkur bgyi pa dang / kun zhu pa dang / slar zhu ba'i slad du bdag mchi'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de bdag gzigs par bzhed na mi mjed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams der bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa de la lta ba dang / phyag 'tshal ba dang / bsnyen bkur bgyi pa dang / kun zhu pa dang / slar zhu ba'i slad du bdag mchi'o //
translated: If the Tathāgata wishes to see me, I will go to that Sahā world to see the Lord Śākyamuni, to pay homage to him, to honor him, to serve him, and to ask him questions.”

original: bcom ldan 'das des bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das des bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: tshangs pa / @40b da ltar mi mjed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams der byang chub sems dpa' bye ba phrag mang po'ang phyin gyi /
analyzed: tshangs pa / @40b da ltar mi mjed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams der byang chub sems dpa' bye ba phrag mang po'ang phyin gyi /
translated: “Brahmā, many millions of bodhisattvas have already gone to that Sahā world.

original: de'i dus la da bab par shes na khyod song zhig /
analyzed: de'i dus la da bab par shes na khyod song zhig /
translated: If you know that the time has come, then go.”

original: tshangs pa / sangs rgyas kyi zhing der lhag pa'i bsam pa bcu rnams kyis gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa / sangs rgyas kyi zhing der lhag pa'i bsam pa bcu rnams kyis gnas par bya'o //
translated: “Brahmā, you should go to that buddhafield with ten superior thoughts.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: snyan par smra ba dang / ngan du smra ba rnams la khong khro ba med pa'i sems dang / snyan pa thos pa dang / mi snyan pa thos pa la byams pa'i sems dang / dus thams cad du sems can rnams la snying rje ba'i sems dang /
analyzed: snyan par smra ba dang / ngan du smra ba rnams la khong khro ba med pa'i sems dang / snyan pa thos pa dang / mi snyan pa thos pa la byams pa'i sems dang / dus thams cad du sems can rnams la snying rje ba'i sems dang /
translated: It is to have a mind that is not angry toward those who speak pleasantly or unpleasantly. It is to have a mind of love when hearing pleasant or unpleasant things. It is to have a mind of compassion for all beings at all times.

original: sems can rab 'bring tha ma rnams la yang dag par sbyor ba dang / ri mo byed pa dang / brnyas par byed pa rnams la sems mnyam pa dang / gzhan gyi ltung ba'i 'khrul ba thams cad la nyes par mi lta ba dang / theg pa sna tshogs la ro gcig pa dang /
analyzed: sems can rab 'bring tha ma rnams la yang dag par sbyor ba dang / ri mo byed pa dang / brnyas par byed pa rnams la sems mnyam pa dang / gzhan gyi ltung ba'i 'khrul ba thams cad la nyes par mi lta ba dang / theg pa sna tshogs la ro gcig pa dang /
translated: It is to be correctly engaged with all beings, whether they are superior, average, or inferior. It is to have an impartial mind toward those who are honored and those who are despised. It is to not see any fault in the mistakes of others. It is to have the same taste for the various vehicles.

original: ngan song gi sdug bsngal thams cad kyi sgras mi skrag pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la ston par 'du shes pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing snyigs ma lnga can na de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba la ngo mtshar du 'du shes pa ste /
analyzed: ngan song gi sdug bsngal thams cad kyi sgras mi skrag pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la ston par 'du shes pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing snyigs ma lnga can na de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba la ngo mtshar du 'du shes pa ste /
translated: It is to not be frightened by the sounds of all the sufferings of the lower realms. It is to perceive all bodhisattvas as teachers. It is to perceive the Thus-Gone One as wondrous when seeing him in a buddha realm with the five degenerations.

original: tshangs pa / lhag pa'i bsam pa bcu po de dag gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing der gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa / lhag pa'i bsam pa bcu po de dag gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing der gnas par bya'o //
translated: Brahma, you should abide in that buddha realm with these ten superior intentions.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshangs pa khyad par sems kyis 'di skad ces gsol to //🔽bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar bdag seng ge'i sgra mi sgrog ste /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshangs pa khyad par sems kyis 'di skad ces gsol to // bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar bdag seng ge'i sgra mi sgrog ste /
translated: Then Brahma Viśeṣacintin said to the Blessed One,

original: 'on kyang bdag gis spyod @41a *//
analyzed: 'on kyang bdag gis spyod @41a *//
translated: “Blessed One, I do not roar the lion’s roar in the presence of the Blessed One.

original: pa gang lags pa'i spyod pa 'di la bcom ldan 'das nyid mngon sum du gyur pas /
analyzed: pa gang lags pa'i spyod pa 'di la bcom ldan 'das nyid mngon sum du gyur pas /
translated: However, since the Blessed One himself is a witness to this conduct,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: bdag gis lhag pa'i bsam pa de dag kyang rnam par sbyang zhing mnyam par gzhag pa'i bye brag gis kyang sangs rgyas kyi zhing der gnas par bgyi'o //
analyzed: bdag gis lhag pa'i bsam pa de dag kyang rnam par sbyang zhing mnyam par gzhag pa'i bye brag gis kyang sangs rgyas kyi zhing der gnas par bgyi'o //
translated: I will purify those superior intentions and abide in that buddha realm with the distinctions of meditative equipoise.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa zla 'od kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing de'i byang chub sems dpa' gzhan dag gis kyang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa zla 'od kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing de'i byang chub sems dpa' gzhan dag gis kyang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the other bodhisattvas in the buddha realm of the Blessed Thus-Gone Candraprabha said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: de ltar sems can ma rungs pa rnams tshogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing der bdag cag ma skyes pa ni rnyed pa legs par rnyed do //
analyzed: de ltar sems can ma rungs pa rnams tshogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing der bdag cag ma skyes pa ni rnyed pa legs par rnyed do //
translated: We have done well not to be born in that buddha-field, where such wicked beings have gathered.

original: bcom ldan 'das des 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das des 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Buddha said,

original: rigs kyi bu khyed rnams /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu khyed rnams /
translated: “Noble sons,

original: de skad ces ma 'dzer cig /
analyzed: de skad ces ma 'dzer cig /
translated: do not speak like that.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rigs kyi bu dag /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag /
translated: Noble sons,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di na gang bskal pa brgya stong du tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa bas mi mjed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams na gang snga dro'i dus gcig sems zhe sdang med par gnas na de bas de shin tu mchog go /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di na gang bskal pa brgya stong du tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa bas mi mjed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams na gang snga dro'i dus gcig sems zhe sdang med par gnas na de bas de shin tu mchog go /
translated: it is better to be angry for a single morning in the Sahā world than to practice pure conduct for a hundred thousand eons in a buddha-field where the lifespan is a hundred thousand eons.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'jig rten gyi khams de ni de tsam du kun nas nyon mongs par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams de ni de tsam du kun nas nyon mongs par gyur pa ste /
translated: That world is so defiled.

original: sems can de dag kyang de tsam du gtse ba mang zhing kun nas nyon mongs pa mang pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can de dag kyang de tsam du gtse ba mang zhing kun nas nyon mongs pa mang pa yin no //
translated: The beings there are so full of malice and defilements.

original: de nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing de nas byang chub @41b sems dpa' stong phrag bcu gnyis tshangs pa khyad par sems dang lhan cig tu chas te /
analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing de nas byang chub @41b sems dpa' stong phrag bcu gnyis tshangs pa khyad par sems dang lhan cig tu chas te /
translated: Then, from that buddha realm, twelve thousand bodhisattvas, together with Brahma Viśeṣacintin, set out.

original: tshangs pa / bdag cag kyang mi mjed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams der mchi'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa / bdag cag kyang mi mjed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams der mchi'o //
translated: “Brahma, we too will go to that Sahā world system.

original: bsam pa 'di dag kyang rnam par spyod do //
analyzed: bsam pa 'di dag kyang rnam par spyod do //
translated: We will engage in these thoughts.

original: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa de la'ang blta'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa de la'ang blta'o //
translated: We will see that Blessed One, Śākyamuni.

original: phyag bgyi'o // bsnyen bkur bgyi'o //
analyzed: phyag bgyi'o // bsnyen bkur bgyi'o //
translated: We will pay homage to him and serve him.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i bye brag gis kyang sangs rgyas kyi zhing der gnas par bgyi'o //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i bye brag gis kyang sangs rgyas kyi zhing der gnas par bgyi'o //
translated: We will also remain in that buddha realm through the specific states of meditative equipoise.”

original: de nas tshangs pa khyad par sems byang chub sems dpa' stong phrag bcu gnyis dang lhan cig tu bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa zla 'od kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal nas /
analyzed: de nas tshangs pa khyad par sems byang chub sems dpa' stong phrag bcu gnyis dang lhan cig tu bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa zla 'od kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal nas /
translated: Then Brahma Viśeṣacintin, together with the twelve thousand bodhisattvas, bowed their heads at the feet of the Blessed One, the thus-gone Candraprabha.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It was like this:🔽a strong man extending his flexed arm

original: skyes bu stobs dang ldan pa'i lag pa bskum pa las brkyang pa'am /
analyzed: skyes bu stobs dang ldan pa'i lag pa bskum pa las brkyang pa'am /
translated: It is like the arm of a strong man that is bent and then straightened.

original: brkyang pa las bskum pa'i skad cig yud tsam thang cig de tsam gyis sangs rgyas kyi zhing der mi snang bar gyur nas bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'dir phyin to //
analyzed: brkyang pa las bskum pa'i skad cig yud tsam thang cig de tsam gyis sangs rgyas kyi zhing der mi snang bar gyur nas bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'dir phyin to //
translated: In the time it takes a strong man to extend and retract his arm, he disappeared from that buddha realm and arrived in this buddha realm of the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddha Śākyamuni.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' dra ba can gyis 'od la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' dra ba can gyis 'od la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the bodhisattva Jālinīprabha,

original: dra ba can gyi 'od /
analyzed: dra ba can gyi 'od /
translated: “Jālinīprabha,

original: khyod kyis tshangs pa khyad par sems 'ong ba mthong ngam /
analyzed: khyod kyis tshangs pa khyad par sems 'ong ba mthong ngam /
translated: do you see Brahmā Viśeṣacintin coming?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, “Blessed One,🔽I see him.”

original: mthong ngo // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: mthong ngo // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: dra ba can gyi 'od /🔽tshangs pa khyad par sems 'di ni byang chub @42a *//
analyzed: dra ba can gyi 'od / tshangs pa khyad par sems 'di ni byang chub @42a *//
translated: “Jālinīprabha,

original: sems dpa' tshul bzhin 'dri ba /🔽kun 'dri ba la mkhas pa rnams kyi nang na mchog go /
analyzed: sems dpa' tshul bzhin 'dri ba / kun 'dri ba la mkhas pa rnams kyi nang na mchog go /
translated: Brahmā Viśeṣacintin is the foremost among bodhisattvas who ask questions in accordance with reality🔽and are skilled in asking all questions.

original: tshig gzung ba rnams kyi nang na mchog go /
analyzed: tshig gzung ba rnams kyi nang na mchog go /
translated: He is the foremost among those whose words are accepted.

original: tshig btsun pa rnams kyi nang na mchog go /
analyzed: tshig btsun pa rnams kyi nang na mchog go /
translated: He is the most venerable of the venerable.

original: tshig 'jam pa rnams kyi nang na mchog go /🔽gsong por smra ba rnams kyi nang na mchog go /
analyzed: tshig 'jam pa rnams kyi nang na mchog go / gsong por smra ba rnams kyi nang na mchog go /
translated: He is the most gentle of the gentle.🔽He is the most polite of the polite.

original: tshig mchod pa rnams kyi nang na mchog go /
analyzed: tshig mchod pa rnams kyi nang na mchog go /
translated: He is the most eloquent of the eloquent.

original: tshig thogs pa med pa rnams kyi nang na mchog go /🔽ldam po dag tu smra ba rnams kyi nang na mchog go /
analyzed: tshig thogs pa med pa rnams kyi nang na mchog go / ldam po dag tu smra ba rnams kyi nang na mchog go /
translated: He is the most unhindered of the unhindered.🔽He is the most eloquent of the eloquent.

original: sems khong khro ba med pa rnams kyi nang na mchog go /🔽byams pa la gnas pa rnams kyi nang na mchog go /
analyzed: sems khong khro ba med pa rnams kyi nang na mchog go / byams pa la gnas pa rnams kyi nang na mchog go /
translated: He is the most free of anger of those who are free of anger.🔽He is the most loving of the loving.

original: snying rje la gnas pa rnams kyi nang na mchog go /
analyzed: snying rje la gnas pa rnams kyi nang na mchog go /
translated: He is the most compassionate of the compassionate.

original: dga' ba la gnas pa rnams kyi nang na mchog go /
analyzed: dga' ba la gnas pa rnams kyi nang na mchog go /
translated: He is the most joyful of the joyful.

original: btang snyoms la gnas pa rnams kyi nang na mchog go /
analyzed: btang snyoms la gnas pa rnams kyi nang na mchog go /
translated: He is the most equanimous of the equanimous.

original: byang chub sems dpa' the tshom thams cad gcod pa dang / kun 'dri ba la mkhas pa rnams kyi nang na mchog go /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' the tshom thams cad gcod pa dang / kun 'dri ba la mkhas pa rnams kyi nang na mchog go /
translated: He is the most skilled of the bodhisattvas in cutting through all doubts and in asking questions.

original: de nas tshangs pa khyad par sems dang / byang chub sems dpa' stong phrag bcu gnyis po de dag lhan cig tu bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der dong nas phyin pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te lan gsum bskor ba byas nas /
analyzed: de nas tshangs pa khyad par sems dang / byang chub sems dpa' stong phrag bcu gnyis po de dag lhan cig tu bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der dong nas phyin pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te lan gsum bskor ba byas nas /
translated: Then Brahma Viśeṣacintin and those twelve thousand bodhisattvas went together to where the Bhagavān was. When they arrived, they bowed their heads to the Bhagavān’s feet, circumambulated him three times,

original: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud nas /
translated: and then stood to one side with their palms together in homage to the Bhagavān.

original: bcom ldan 'das la tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis @42b rnam pa mang pos mngon par bstod do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis @42b rnam pa mang pos mngon par bstod do //
translated: They praised the Bhagavān with many kinds of praises in verse:

original: rnam par sgra bsgrags srid pa gsum du grags //
analyzed: rnam par sgra bsgrags srid pa gsum du grags //
translated: “You have proclaimed the Dharma in the three existences.

original: bsngags pa'i phreng ba 'jig rten kun tu rgyu //
analyzed: bsngags pa'i phreng ba 'jig rten kun tu rgyu //
translated: The garlands of your praises resound throughout the world.

original: bdag gis sems can mchog rnams zhing na mthong //
analyzed: bdag gis sems can mchog rnams zhing na mthong //
translated: I see the supreme beings in the fields,

original: de dag kun kyang khyed kyi yon tan gsungs //
analyzed: de dag kun kyang khyed kyi yon tan gsungs //
translated: all of them proclaiming your qualities.

original: 'di na yongs su dag pa'i zhing mchis te //
analyzed: 'di na yongs su dag pa'i zhing mchis te //
translated: Here is a completely pure field,

original: dri ma ma mchis ngan song gsum spangs pa //
analyzed: dri ma ma mchis ngan song gsum spangs pa //
translated: free of stains, free of the three lower existences,

original: de 'dra'i zhing rnams de dag rnam spangs nas //
analyzed: de 'dra'i zhing rnams de dag rnam spangs nas //
translated: Having abandoned such fields,

original: khyed kyi thugs rjes ngan pa yongs su bzung //
analyzed: khyed kyi thugs rjes ngan pa yongs su bzung //
translated: you are accepted by your compassion,

original: 'jig rten mgon khyod ye shes dman ma mchis //
analyzed: 'jig rten mgon khyod ye shes dman ma mchis //
translated: O Protector of the World, you have no lack of wisdom.

original: ma lus bde bar gshegs dang khyod du mtshungs //
analyzed: ma lus bde bar gshegs dang khyod du mtshungs //
translated: You are equal to all Sugatas without exception.

original: shin tu rnam dag bsam pa mngon mdzad pa //
analyzed: shin tu rnam dag bsam pa mngon mdzad pa //
translated: You have accomplished the utterly pure intention,

original: 'di 'dra ba yi zhing 'di khyod kyis bzung //
analyzed: 'di 'dra ba yi zhing 'di khyod kyis bzung //
translated: and you have accepted this field, which is like this.

original: tshul khrims thams cad rnam dag 'dod spangs nas //
analyzed: tshul khrims thams cad rnam dag 'dod spangs nas //
translated: Having abandoned the desire for all pure discipline,

original: gang zhig bskal par gzhan na spyod pa bas //🔽su dag byams pa'i sems kyis shin tu 'dir //
analyzed: gang zhig bskal par gzhan na spyod pa bas // su dag byams pa'i sems kyis shin tu 'dir //
translated: what is practiced for eons in other places,🔽if one practices here for just an instant with a loving mind,

original: skad cig spyod na'ang 'dir ni khyad par 'phags //
analyzed: skad cig spyod na'ang 'dir ni khyad par 'phags //
translated: it is superior to that.

original: lus dang ngag dang 'on te yid kyis kyang //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang 'on te yid kyis kyang //
translated: Whatever faults are committed, whether by body, speech, or mind,

original: gang la nyes bgyis rnam pa gsum mchis te //
analyzed: gang la nyes bgyis rnam pa gsum mchis te //
translated: if one has three kinds of faults,

original: ngan song gsum du myong bar grang 'gyur ba //
analyzed: ngan song gsum du myong bar grang 'gyur ba //
translated: one will experience the three lower realms.

original: de ni tshe 'di nyid la 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni tshe 'di nyid la 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: That will occur in this very life.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'di na gang mchis pa //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'di na gang mchis pa //
translated: The bodhisattvas who are here

original: de dag rtag tu gdung bar mi bgyi ste //
analyzed: de dag rtag tu gdung bar mi bgyi ste //
translated: They will never be tormented by them.

original: de yi las gang log ltung mchi ba yang //
analyzed: de yi las gang log ltung mchi ba yang //
translated: Even if they commit an action that would lead to a downfall,

original: de dag 'dir ni klad pa na bas 'byang //
analyzed: de dag 'dir ni klad pa na bas 'byang //
translated: They will be cured of it by a headache.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' skyon med grang //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' skyon med grang //
translated: This is the faultless state of the bodhisattvas.

original: dam pa'i chos gsungs @43a *//
analyzed: dam pa'i chos gsungs @43a *//
translated: They teach the sacred Dharma.

original: chos mchog 'dzin pa rnams //
analyzed: chos mchog 'dzin pa rnams //
translated: They uphold the supreme Dharma.

original: de dag 'di las phyin chad nam du yang //
analyzed: de dag 'di las phyin chad nam du yang //
translated: From now on, in all their lives,

original: dran pa mi 'khrug blo yang nyams mi 'gyur //
analyzed: dran pa mi 'khrug blo yang nyams mi 'gyur //
translated: Their mindfulness will not be disturbed, nor will their minds deteriorate.🔽Those who wish to cut through the bonds of Māra

original: gang zhing bdud kyis bcings pa gcad pa dang // de bzhin nyon mongs las bcas spyod 'tshal ba //
analyzed: gang zhing bdud kyis bcings pa gcad pa dang // de bzhin nyon mongs las bcas spyod 'tshal ba //
translated: And likewise to engage in the conduct of afflictions and karma,

original: de ni zhing 'dir dam pa'i chos nyid gsungs //
analyzed: de ni zhing 'dir dam pa'i chos nyid gsungs //
translated: They should teach the sacred Dharma in this realm.

original: 'di la ye shes ldan pa'i mchog tu 'gyur //🔽gang zhig bskal pa bye bar zhing gzhan du //
analyzed: 'di la ye shes ldan pa'i mchog tu 'gyur // gang zhig bskal pa bye bar zhing gzhan du //
translated: Here they will become supreme in their possession of wisdom.🔽Those who uphold the sacred Dharma in other realms

original: sems ldan dam chos 'dzin pa gyur pa bas //
analyzed: sems ldan dam chos 'dzin pa gyur pa bas //
translated: For ten million eons, with their minds focused,

original: su dag snga dro cig tsam mi mjed du //
analyzed: su dag snga dro cig tsam mi mjed du //
translated: And those who do so for just one morning in this Sahā realm,

original: 'di ni de bas mchog tu mkhas pas dgongs //
analyzed: 'di ni de bas mchog tu mkhas pas dgongs //
translated: The wise consider the latter to be superior.

original: gang gis mngon par dga' ba'i 'jig rten dang // de bzhin tshe dpag med kyi bde can mchog /
analyzed: gang gis mngon par dga' ba'i 'jig rten dang // de bzhin tshe dpag med kyi bde can mchog /
translated: The world of Abhirati and the supreme bliss of Amitāyus,

original: de na sdug bsngal sdug bsngal sgra ma mchis //
analyzed: de na sdug bsngal sdug bsngal sgra ma mchis //
translated: There is no suffering or even the word for suffering.

original: der ni yon tan bgyi ba rmad mi che //
analyzed: der ni yon tan bgyi ba rmad mi che //
translated: It is not so amazing to create good qualities there.

original: nyon mongs 'byung gnas 'jig rten nyes gang 'dir //
analyzed: nyon mongs 'byung gnas 'jig rten nyes gang 'dir //
translated: This world is the source of afflictions and faults,

original: zhe sdang can gyi rab tu nyes bzod la //
analyzed: zhe sdang can gyi rab tu nyes bzod la //
translated: Forbearance is difficult for the angry,

original: chos 'di la yang gzhan dag 'dzud pa ni //
analyzed: chos 'di la yang gzhan dag 'dzud pa ni //
translated: And to lead others to this Dharma

original: 'di ni de bas dka' ba'i mchog tu 'gyur //
analyzed: 'di ni de bas dka' ba'i mchog tu 'gyur //
translated: Is the most difficult of all.

original: snying rjes rlan sems sdug bsngal mang las grol //
analyzed: snying rjes rlan sems sdug bsngal mang las grol //
translated: With a mind moistened by compassion, one is freed from much suffering.

original: bla med bla ma khyod la bdag phyag 'tshal //
analyzed: bla med bla ma khyod la bdag phyag 'tshal //
translated: I pay homage to you, O unsurpassed guru.

original: gtum sems can la chos gang 'chad pa ni //
analyzed: gtum sems can la chos gang 'chad pa ni //
translated: The Dharma that is taught to the ill-tempered

original: bdag po 'jig rten na yang de spyad dka'//
analyzed: bdag po 'jig rten na yang de spyad dka'//
translated: Is difficult to practice even for the lord of the world.

original: shin tu rgya che ba yi 'khor 'di dang // phyogs su rnam par grags pa'i sangs rgyas sras //
analyzed: shin tu rgya che ba yi 'khor 'di dang // phyogs su rnam par grags pa'i sangs rgyas sras //
translated: This assembly is vast, and the Buddha's disciples are renowned in all directions,

original: chos kyis mi ngoms rgya mtsho 'dra ba @43b tshogs //
analyzed: chos kyis mi ngoms rgya mtsho 'dra ba @43b tshogs //
translated: Like an ocean insatiable for the water that flows into it.

original: de dag la ni rgyal ba'i byang chub gsungs //
analyzed: de dag la ni rgyal ba'i byang chub gsungs //
translated: And the Victorious One taught the enlightenment of the buddhas.🔽Brahmā, Indra, the guardians of the world,

original: tshangs pa dbang po 'jig rten skyong ba dang // lha klu lha min mi 'am cir bcas pa //
analyzed: tshangs pa dbang po 'jig rten skyong ba dang // lha klu lha min mi 'am cir bcas pa //
translated: The gods, nāgas, asuras, and kinnaras,

original: chos nyid 'tshal ba mang po tshogs pa la //
analyzed: chos nyid 'tshal ba mang po tshogs pa la //
translated: And the many who have gathered, seeking the Dharma,

original: ji ltar mos pa bzhin du chos nyid gsungs //
analyzed: ji ltar mos pa bzhin du chos nyid gsungs //
translated: Teach the Dharma according to their aspirations.🔽The lay brothers and sisters, monks and nuns,

original: dge bsnyen dge bsnyen ma dang dge slong dang // dge slong ma dang 'khor bzhi 'di dag tshogs //
analyzed: dge bsnyen dge bsnyen ma dang dge slong dang // dge slong ma dang 'khor bzhi 'di dag tshogs //
translated: This assembly of the fourfold retinue,

original: ji ltar thos nas nor grub rab 'dod par //
analyzed: ji ltar thos nas nor grub rab 'dod par //
translated: Having heard, they wish to attain the treasure of accomplishment.

original: de ltar de dag la ni chos bstan gsol //

original: nyan thos kyi sems rnam par spong ba dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi yid la byed pa gtong ba dang / chos yongs su 'tshol bas mi ngoms pa dang / ji ltar thos pa bzhin du chos ston pa ste bzhi po 'di dag go /
