translated: They are to abandon the mind of the hearers, to give up the attention of the solitary buddhas, to be insatiable in seeking the Dharma, and to teach the Dharma in accordance with what they have heard.

original: tshangs pa / chos bzhi dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams chos yongs su 'tshol te /
analyzed: tshangs pa / chos bzhi dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams chos yongs su 'tshol te /
translated: Brahmā, if bodhisattva mahāsattvas have four qualities, they will seek the Dharma.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: rnyed par dka' ba'i phyir rin po cher 'du shes pa dang / nad thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed pa'i phyir rtsir 'du shes pa dang / chud mi za ba'i phyir don du 'du shes pa dang / mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir sdug bsngal thams cad zhi bar 'du shes pa ste /
analyzed: rnyed par dka' ba'i phyir rin po cher 'du shes pa dang / nad thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed pa'i phyir rtsir 'du shes pa dang / chud mi za ba'i phyir don du 'du shes pa dang / mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir sdug bsngal thams cad zhi bar 'du shes pa ste /
translated: They are the recognition of the Dharma as a jewel because it is difficult to obtain, the recognition of the Dharma as medicine because it cures all illnesses, the recognition of the Dharma as meaningful because it is not wasted, and the recognition of the Dharma as the pacification of all suffering because it leads to nirvāṇa.

original: bzhi po 'di dag go /
analyzed: bzhi po 'di dag go /
translated: Those are the four.

original: tshangs pa / chos bzhi dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ltung ba las 'byung ba la mkhas pa rnams yin te /
analyzed: tshangs pa / chos bzhi dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ltung ba las 'byung ba la mkhas pa rnams yin te /
translated: Brahmā, if bodhisattva mahāsattvas have four qualities, they will be skilled in rising above downfalls.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: nang nas mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa dang / mi 'pho bas mi 'gag pa la bzod pa dang / rgyu la so sor rtog pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la bzod pa dang / gcig nas gcig tu sems phan tshun du gyur pa ste bzhi po 'di dag go /🔽tshangs pa / chos bzhi dang ldan na /
analyzed: nang nas mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa dang / mi 'pho bas mi 'gag pa la bzod pa dang / rgyu la so sor rtog pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la bzod pa dang / gcig nas gcig tu sems phan tshun du gyur pa ste bzhi po 'di dag go / tshangs pa / chos bzhi dang ldan na /
translated: the acceptance that phenomena are unborn from within, the acceptance that they do not cease due to not moving, the acceptance of dependent origination through discerning the causes, and the mind transforming from one to another.🔽Brahmā, if bodhisattva mahāsattvas possess four qualities,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams nyon mongs pa rnam par sbyong ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams nyon mongs pa rnam par sbyong ste /
translated: they will purify afflictions.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /🔽tshul bzhin du so sor rtog pa dang / ma 'ongs pa na sdom pa dang / dkar po'i chos kyi @47a *//
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na / tshul bzhin du so sor rtog pa dang / ma 'ongs pa na sdom pa dang / dkar po'i chos kyi @47a *//
translated: What are the four?🔽Correct discernment, restraint in the future,

original: stobs bskyed pa dang / rab tu dben par gnas pa ste /
analyzed: stobs bskyed pa dang / rab tu dben par gnas pa ste /
translated: the power of virtuous qualities, and dwelling in solitude.

original: bzhi po 'di dag go /
analyzed: bzhi po 'di dag go /
translated: These are the four.

original: tshangs pa / chos bzhi dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams 'khor gyi nang du 'gro ste /
analyzed: tshangs pa / chos bzhi dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams 'khor gyi nang du 'gro ste /
translated: Brahmā, if bodhisattva mahāsattvas possess four qualities, they will go among the assembly.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: chos 'dod pa'i phyir te klan ka 'tshol ba'i bsam pas ma yin pa dang / ri mo dang bcas pa'i phyir te nga rgyal dang / khengs pas ma yin pa dang / dge ba gang yin pa 'tshol ba'i phyir te bdag sbyoms pas ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: chos 'dod pa'i phyir te klan ka 'tshol ba'i bsam pas ma yin pa dang / ri mo dang bcas pa'i phyir te nga rgyal dang / khengs pas ma yin pa dang / dge ba gang yin pa 'tshol ba'i phyir te bdag sbyoms pas ma yin pa dang /
translated: It is for the sake of the Dharma, not for the sake of finding fault; it is with respect, not with pride or arrogance; it is in search of virtue, not for the sake of self-aggrandizement;

original: sems can rnams dge ba'i rtsa ba la gzud pa'i phyir te rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa'i phyir ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams dge ba'i rtsa ba la gzud pa'i phyir te rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa'i phyir ma yin pa ste /
translated: and it is in order to introduce sentient beings to the roots of virtue, not for the sake of gain, honor, or praise.

original: bzhi po 'di dag go /
analyzed: bzhi po 'di dag go /
translated: These are the four.

original: tshangs pa / chos bzhi dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams chos kyi sbyin pa rnam par 'byed de /
analyzed: tshangs pa / chos bzhi dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams chos kyi sbyin pa rnam par 'byed de /
translated: Brahmā, if bodhisattva great beings possess four qualities, they will analyze the gift of the Dharma.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa dang / bdag nyid kyi shes rab gsal bar byed pa dang / skyes bu dam pa'i las byed pa dang; kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba ston pa ste /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa dang / bdag nyid kyi shes rab gsal bar byed pa dang / skyes bu dam pa'i las byed pa dang; kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba ston pa ste /
translated: They are upholding the sublime Dharma, illuminating their own wisdom, performing the deeds of sublime beings, and teaching about affliction and purification.

original: bzhi po 'di dag go /
analyzed: bzhi po 'di dag go /
translated: These are the four.

original: tshangs pa / chos bzhi dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams rgyu'i stobs dang ldan pas dge ba'i rtsa ba chud mi za ba yin te /
analyzed: tshangs pa / chos bzhi dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams rgyu'i stobs dang ldan pas dge ba'i rtsa ba chud mi za ba yin te /
translated: Brahmā, if bodhisattva mahāsattvas have four qualities, then, through possessing the power of the cause, their roots of virtue will not be wasted.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: gzhan gyi 'khrul ba la nyes par mi lta ba dang / khros pa rnams la byams pa sgom @47b pa dang / chos rnams kyi rgyu ston pa dang / byang chub kyi sems mi gtong ba ste bzhi po 'di dag go /
analyzed: gzhan gyi 'khrul ba la nyes par mi lta ba dang / khros pa rnams la byams pa sgom @47b pa dang / chos rnams kyi rgyu ston pa dang / byang chub kyi sems mi gtong ba ste bzhi po 'di dag go /
translated: They are not seeing faults in the mistakes of others, cultivating love for those who are angry, teaching the causes of phenomena, and not giving up the mind of awakening.

original: tshangs pa / chos bzhi dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams pha rol tu phyin pa drug la ma bstan par shes pa rnams yin te /
analyzed: tshangs pa / chos bzhi dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams pha rol tu phyin pa drug la ma bstan par shes pa rnams yin te /
translated: Brahmā, if bodhisattva mahāsattvas have four qualities, they will understand the six perfections without being taught.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: sbyin pa dag la sngon du 'gro ba rnams yin /
analyzed: sbyin pa dag la sngon du 'gro ba rnams yin /
translated: They are being a precursor to generosity,

original: ltung ba rnams kyi pha rol la rtsod par mi byed pa yin /
analyzed: ltung ba rnams kyi pha rol la rtsod par mi byed pa yin /
translated: not arguing with those who have fallen,

original: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir bsdu ba'i dngos po la mkhas pa yin /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir bsdu ba'i dngos po la mkhas pa yin /
translated: being skilled in the means of gathering in order to ripen beings,🔽and

original: chos rnams la zab mor mos pa rnams yin te bzhi po 'di dag go /
analyzed: chos rnams la zab mor mos pa rnams yin te bzhi po 'di dag go /
translated: They are the four: those who are interested in the profound, those who are interested in the vast, those who are interested in the profound and the vast, and those who are interested in the profound and vast Dharma.

original: tshangs pa / chos bzhi dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams bsam gtan la gnas nas 'dod pa'i khams su skye'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa / chos bzhi dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams bsam gtan la gnas nas 'dod pa'i khams su skye'o //
translated: Brahmā, if they have four qualities, then bodhisattva great beings, abiding in concentration, are born in the desire realm.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: sems las su rung ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyis stobs bskyed pa dang / sems can rnams yongs su mi gtong ba dang / thabs dang / shes rab sgom pa ste /
analyzed: sems las su rung ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyis stobs bskyed pa dang / sems can rnams yongs su mi gtong ba dang / thabs dang / shes rab sgom pa ste /
translated: They are the four: mental flexibility, the generation of the power of roots of virtue, not abandoning sentient beings, and cultivating method and wisdom.

original: bzhi po 'di dag go /
analyzed: bzhi po 'di dag go /
translated: Those are the four.

original: tshangs pa / chos bzhi dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams las phyir mi ldog pa yin te /
analyzed: tshangs pa / chos bzhi dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams las phyir mi ldog pa yin te /
translated: Brahmā, if they have four qualities, then bodhisattva great beings do not turn back from the buddhadharmas.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'khor ba dpag tu med pa yongs su 'dzin pa dang / sangs rgyas dpag tu med pa la mchod cing rim gror byed pa dang / byams pa dpag tu med pa sgom pa dang / snying rje dpag tu med pa sgom pa ste bzhi bo 'di dag go /
analyzed: 'khor ba dpag tu med pa yongs su 'dzin pa dang / sangs rgyas dpag tu med pa la mchod cing rim gror byed pa dang / byams pa dpag tu med pa sgom pa dang / snying rje dpag tu med pa sgom pa ste bzhi bo 'di dag go /
translated: They are: (1) taking on the responsibility for an immeasurable samsara; (2) making offerings and rendering service to immeasurable Buddhas; (3) cultivating immeasurable love; and (4) cultivating immeasurable compassion.

original: tshangs pa / @48a *//
analyzed: tshangs pa / @48a *//
translated: Brahma,

original: chos bzhi dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams sangs rgyas kyi rigs mi gcod de /
analyzed: chos bzhi dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams sangs rgyas kyi rigs mi gcod de /
translated: if they possess four qualities, the Bodhisattva-mahāsattvas do not cut off the lineage of the Buddhas.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: sngar dam bcas pa las phyir mi 'gyur ba dang / ji skad smras pa de bzhin byed pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams la shin tu mos pa dang / bsam pa'i nan tan la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: sngar dam bcas pa las phyir mi 'gyur ba dang / ji skad smras pa de bzhin byed pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams la shin tu mos pa dang / bsam pa'i nan tan la gnas pa ste /
translated: They are: (1) not turning back from their previous commitments; (2) acting in accordance with their words; (3) having great interest in the roots of virtue; and (4) abiding in the practice of intention.

original: tshangs pa / chos bzhi po 'di dag dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams sangs rgyas kyi rigs mi gcod do //
analyzed: tshangs pa / chos bzhi po 'di dag dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams sangs rgyas kyi rigs mi gcod do //
translated: Brahma, if they possess these four qualities, the Bodhisattva-mahāsattvas do not cut off the lineage of the Buddhas.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bzhi pa mngon par bsgrub pa 'di bshad pa na; lha dang / mir bcas pa'i skye dgu rnams las srog chags stong phrag sum cu rtsa gnyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyes so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bzhi pa mngon par bsgrub pa 'di bshad pa na; lha dang / mir bcas pa'i skye dgu rnams las srog chags stong phrag sum cu rtsa gnyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyes so //
translated: When the Blessed One had explained this fourth practice, thirty-two thousand beings from among the gods and humans gave rise to the mind set on unsurpassed and perfect awakening.

original: byang chub sems dpa' lnga stong yang mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa skyes so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' lnga stong yang mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa skyes so //
translated: Five thousand bodhisattvas also gave rise to the acceptance of the non-arising of phenomena.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs nas 'dus pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis kyang bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa bya ba'i phyir stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'dir lha'i me tog rnams kyis pus mo nub pa tsam du khebs par byas
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs nas 'dus pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis kyang bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa bya ba'i phyir stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'dir lha'i me tog rnams kyis pus mo nub pa tsam du khebs par byas
translated: The bodhisattvas who had gathered from various buddha-fields also covered this entire trichiliocosm with divine flowers up to their knees in order to make offerings to the Blessed One.

original: so // de nas gzhon nur gyur pa dra ba can gyi 'od kyis tshangs pa khyad par sems la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: so // de nas gzhon nur gyur pa dra ba can gyi 'od kyis tshangs pa khyad par sems la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the youth Jālinīprabha said to Brahma­viśeṣacintin:

original: tshangs pa / khyod bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' tshul bzhin dri ba la mkhas pa @48b rnams kyi mchog tu gsungs na /
analyzed: tshangs pa / khyod bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' tshul bzhin dri ba la mkhas pa @48b rnams kyi mchog tu gsungs na /
translated: Brahma, you have been declared by the Lord to be the best of those who are skilled in asking questions of the Bodhisattvas in the right way.

original: de ji ltar dris na byang chub sems dpa' tshul bzhin dri ba yin /
analyzed: de ji ltar dris na byang chub sems dpa' tshul bzhin dri ba yin /
translated: How is it that a Bodhisattva asks questions in the right way?

original: khyad par sems kyis smras pa /
analyzed: khyad par sems kyis smras pa /
translated: Viśeṣa-cintin said:

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family,

original: bdag tu sgro 'dogs pas 'dri na tshul bzhin ma yin pas 'dri'o //
analyzed: bdag tu sgro 'dogs pas 'dri na tshul bzhin ma yin pas 'dri'o //
translated: if one asks with the superimposition of a self, one asks in the wrong way.

original: gzhan du sgro 'dogs pas 'dri na tshul bzhin ma yin par 'dri'o //
analyzed: gzhan du sgro 'dogs pas 'dri na tshul bzhin ma yin par 'dri'o //
translated: If one asks with the superimposition of another, one asks in the wrong way.

original: chos su sgro 'dogs pas 'dri na tshul bzhin ma yin par 'dri'o //
analyzed: chos su sgro 'dogs pas 'dri na tshul bzhin ma yin par 'dri'o //
translated: If one asks with the superimposition of phenomena, one asks in the wrong way.

original: dra ba can gyi 'od /
analyzed: dra ba can gyi 'od /
translated: Jālinīprabha,

original: gang la bdag tu sgro 'dogs pa med pa dang / gzhan du sgro 'dogs pa med pa dang / chos su sgro 'dogs pa med pa 'di ni tshul bzhin 'dri'o //
analyzed: gang la bdag tu sgro 'dogs pa med pa dang / gzhan du sgro 'dogs pa med pa dang / chos su sgro 'dogs pa med pa 'di ni tshul bzhin 'dri'o //
translated: if there is no superimposition of a self, no superimposition of another, and no superimposition of phenomena, this is asking in the right way.

original: gzhan yang dra ba can gyi 'od /
analyzed: gzhan yang dra ba can gyi 'od /
translated: Moreover, Jālinīprabha,

original: skye ba'i phyir 'dri na tshul bzhin ma yin par 'dri'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i phyir 'dri na tshul bzhin ma yin par 'dri'o //
translated: if one asks for the sake of birth, one asks in the wrong way.

original: 'gag pa'i phyir 'dri na tshul bzhin ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'gag pa'i phyir 'dri na tshul bzhin ma yin pa'o //
translated: If you ask about cessation, that is not proper.

original: gnas dang / gnas ma yin pa'i phyir 'dri na de ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gnas dang / gnas ma yin pa'i phyir 'dri na de ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa'o //
translated: If you ask about what is possible and what is impossible, that is not proper.

original: dra ba can gyi 'od /
analyzed: dra ba can gyi 'od /
translated: Jālinīprabha,

original: gang la chos gang yang skye ba'i phyir ram /
analyzed: gang la chos gang yang skye ba'i phyir ram /
translated: if you do not ask about the arising of any dharma,

original: 'gag pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: 'gag pa'i phyir ram /
translated: or about cessation,

original: gnas dang / gnas ma yin pa'i phyir 'dri ba med pa de ni tshul bzhin 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: gnas dang / gnas ma yin pa'i phyir 'dri ba med pa de ni tshul bzhin 'dri ba'o //
translated: or about what is possible and what is impossible, that is proper questioning.

original: gzhan yang / dra ba can gyi 'od /
analyzed: gzhan yang / dra ba can gyi 'od /
translated: Moreover, Jālinīprabha,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyir 'dri na de ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyir 'dri na de ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa'o //
translated: if you ask about affliction, that is not proper.

original: rnam par byang ba'i phyir 'dri na de ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa'o //🔽'khor ba'i phyir 'dri na de ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i phyir 'dri na de ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa'o // 'khor ba'i phyir 'dri na de ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa'o //
translated: If you ask about purification, that is not proper.🔽If you ask about saṃsāra, that is not proper.

original: 'khor ba las shin tu bzla ba'i phyir 'dri na de ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba las shin tu bzla ba'i phyir 'dri na de ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa'o //
translated: If you ask about transcending saṃsāra, that is not proper.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i @49a *//
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i @49a *//
translated: If you ask about nirvāṇa,

original: phyir 'dri na de ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: phyir 'dri na de ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa'o //
translated: that is not proper.

original: dra ba can gyi 'od /
analyzed: dra ba can gyi 'od /
translated: Jālinīprabha,

original: gang la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: gang la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyir ma yin /
translated: It is not because they are afflicted.

original: rnam par byang ba'i phyir ma yin /🔽'khor ba'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i phyir ma yin / 'khor ba'i phyir ma yin /
translated: It is not for the sake of defilement or purification,🔽not for the sake of samsara or nirvana,

original: 'khor ba las shin tu bzla ba'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: 'khor ba las shin tu bzla ba'i phyir ma yin /
translated: not for the sake of the conditioned or the unconditioned,🔽not for the sake of the compounded or the uncompounded.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir 'dri ba med pa de ni tshul bzhin 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir 'dri ba med pa de ni tshul bzhin 'dri ba'o //
translated: Such questioning is proper.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos mi 'gyur ba nyid ni kun nas nyon mi mongs /
analyzed: chos mi 'gyur ba nyid ni kun nas nyon mi mongs /
translated: The unchanging nature of phenomena is not defiled,

original: rnam par byang bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: rnam par byang bar mi 'gyur /
translated: not purified,

original: mi 'khor zhing yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: mi 'khor zhing yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da'o //
translated: not subject to samsara, and not subject to nirvana.

original: gzhan yang / dra ba can gyi 'od /🔽'thob pa'i phyir 'dri na de ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang / dra ba can gyi 'od / 'thob pa'i phyir 'dri na de ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa'o //
translated: Moreover, Jālinīprabha,🔽if you ask about attainment, that is improper.

original: mngon du bya ba'i phyir 'dri na de ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa'o //🔽mngon par shes pa'i phyir 'dri na de ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mngon du bya ba'i phyir 'dri na de ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa'o // mngon par shes pa'i phyir 'dri na de ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa'o //
translated: If you ask about realization, that is improper.🔽If you ask about the superknowledges, that is improper.

original: yongs su shes pa dang / sgom pa'i phyir 'dri na de ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su shes pa dang / sgom pa'i phyir 'dri na de ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa'o //
translated: If you ask about thorough cognition and cultivation, that is improper.

original: 'bral ba'i phyir 'dri na de ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'bral ba'i phyir 'dri na de ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa'o //
translated: If you ask in order to be separated from them, that is not proper.

original: dra ba can gyi 'od /
analyzed: dra ba can gyi 'od /
translated: Jālinīprabha,

original: gang la thogs pa med pa dang / 'dzin pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa dang / kun tu rtog pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa med pa dang / gnas med pa dang / bsgom pa med pa dang /
analyzed: gang la thogs pa med pa dang / 'dzin pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa dang / kun tu rtog pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa med pa dang / gnas med pa dang / bsgom pa med pa dang /
translated: if you ask without obstruction, without grasping, without mental construction, without higher knowledge, without basis, without meditation,

original: bsgom par lta ba med pa de ni tshul bzhin 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: bsgom par lta ba med pa de ni tshul bzhin 'dri ba'o //
translated: and without the view of meditation, that is proper.

original: gzhan yang / dra ba can gyi 'od /
analyzed: gzhan yang / dra ba can gyi 'od /
translated: Moreover, Jālinīprabha,

original: 'di ni dge ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dge ba'o //
translated: if you ask, ‘This is virtuous;

original: 'di ni mi dge ba'o //🔽'di ni zag pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mi dge ba'o // 'di ni zag pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: this is nonvirtuous;🔽this is contaminated;

original: 'di ni zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zag pa med pa'o //
translated: this is uncontaminated;

original: 'di ni kha na ma @49b tho ba dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni kha na ma @49b tho ba dang bcas pa'o //
translated: this is blameworthy;

original: 'di ni kha na ma thob med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni kha na ma thob med pa'o //
translated: this is blameless;

original: 'di ni 'dus byas so //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dus byas so //
translated: this is compounded;

original: 'di ni 'dus ma byas so //🔽'di ni 'jig rten pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dus ma byas so // 'di ni 'jig rten pa'o //
translated: this is uncompounded;🔽this is mundane;

original: 'di ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
translated: this is supramundane,’

original: zhes 'drin de ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: zhes 'drin de ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa ste /
translated: that is not proper.

original: dra ba can gyi 'od /
analyzed: dra ba can gyi 'od /
translated: Jālinīprabha,

original: ji tsam du gnyis su 'jug pas 'dri ba de tsam du tshul bzhin ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: ji tsam du gnyis su 'jug pas 'dri ba de tsam du tshul bzhin ma yin pa'o //
translated: To the extent that one engages in dualistic questioning, to that extent one is not in accord with reality.

original: dra ba can gyi 'od /
analyzed: dra ba can gyi 'od /
translated: Jālinīprabha,

original: gang la gnyis med pa dang / gnyis ma yin pa med pa dang // 'du shes med pa dang / ming med pa dang / spyi mi 'jug pa de ni tshul bzhin 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: gang la gnyis med pa dang / gnyis ma yin pa med pa dang // 'du shes med pa dang / ming med pa dang / spyi mi 'jug pa de ni tshul bzhin 'dri ba'o //
translated: where there is no duality, no non-duality, no perception, no name, and no engagement of the general, that is the proper questioning.

original: gzhan yang / dra ba can gyi 'od /
analyzed: gzhan yang / dra ba can gyi 'od /
translated: Moreover, Jālinīprabha,

original: sangs rgyas tha dad du byed pa dang / chos tha dad du byed pa dang / dge 'dun tha dad du byed pa dang / zhing tha dad du byed pa dang / sems can tha dad du byed pa dang / thag pa tha dad du byed pa de dag ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas tha dad du byed pa dang / chos tha dad du byed pa dang / dge 'dun tha dad du byed pa dang / zhing tha dad du byed pa dang / sems can tha dad du byed pa dang / thag pa tha dad du byed pa de dag ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa'o //
translated: those who make distinctions of buddhas, distinctions of the Dharma, distinctions of the Saṅgha, distinctions of realms, distinctions of sentient beings, and distinctions of entanglements, they are not in accord with reality.

original: dra ba can gyi 'od /🔽gang la chos gang yang tha dad par ram /
analyzed: dra ba can gyi 'od / gang la chos gang yang tha dad par ram /
translated: Jālinīprabha,🔽where no phenomenon is questioned as distinct

original: gcig par mi 'dri ba de ni tshul bzhin 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: gcig par mi 'dri ba de ni tshul bzhin 'dri ba'o //
translated: or as one, that is the proper questioning.

original: gzhan yang / dra ba can gyi 'od /
analyzed: gzhan yang / dra ba can gyi 'od /
translated: Moreover, Jālinīprabha,

original: chos thams cad ni tshul bzhin no; ;chos thams cad ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni tshul bzhin no; ;chos thams cad ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa'o //
translated: All phenomena are not in accordance with reality.

original: smras pa / tshangs pa ji ltar na chos thams cad ni tshul bzhin /
analyzed: smras pa / tshangs pa ji ltar na chos thams cad ni tshul bzhin /
translated: Brahmā, how are all phenomena in accordance with reality?

original: chos thams cad ni tshul bzhin ma yin /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni tshul bzhin ma yin /
translated: How are all phenomena not in accordance with reality?

original: smras pa / chos thams cad bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir chos thams cad ni tshul bzhin no //
analyzed: smras pa / chos thams cad bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir chos thams cad ni tshul bzhin no //
translated: He replied, “All phenomena are in accordance with reality because all phenomena are inconceivable.

original: chos thams cad bsam gyis mi khyab pa la sems par zhugs pa de dag ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad bsam gyis mi khyab pa la sems par zhugs pa de dag ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa'o //
translated: Those who engage in conceiving of all phenomena as inconceivable are not in accordance with reality.

original: @50a *// chos thams cad ni dben pa'i mtshan nyid de ni tshul bzhin no //🔽gang dben pa la ma mos pa de dag ni lhag par byed pa la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: @50a *// chos thams cad ni dben pa'i mtshan nyid de ni tshul bzhin no // gang dben pa la ma mos pa de dag ni lhag par byed pa la zhugs pa'o //
translated: All phenomena are in accordance with reality because all phenomena are characterized by solitude.🔽Those who do not aspire to solitude are engaged in exaggeration.

original: gang lhag par byed pa la zhugs pa de dag ni lhag par byed pa la brtson pa'o //
analyzed: gang lhag par byed pa la zhugs pa de dag ni lhag par byed pa la brtson pa'o //
translated: Those who are engaged in exaggeration are diligent in exaggeration.

original: gang lhag par byed pa la brtson pa de dag ji tsam du lhag par byed pa de tsam du tshul bzhin du ma yin pa'o; ;smras pa /
analyzed: gang lhag par byed pa la brtson pa de dag ji tsam du lhag par byed pa de tsam du tshul bzhin du ma yin pa'o; ;smras pa /
translated: Those who strive to be superior are not correct in their practice, to the extent that they are striving to be superior.

original: tshangs pa / chos rnams kyi tshul gang yin /
analyzed: tshangs pa / chos rnams kyi tshul gang yin /
translated: ” He said, “Brahmā, what is the way of phenomena?”

original: smras pa / rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: smras pa / rigs kyi bu /
translated: He said, “Son of noble family,

original: rang gi yul dben pa 'dod chags dang bral ba'i mtha' ni chos rnams kyi tshul lo; ;smras pa /
analyzed: rang gi yul dben pa 'dod chags dang bral ba'i mtha' ni chos rnams kyi tshul lo; ;smras pa /
translated: the limit of the freedom from desire, the isolation of one’s own domain, is the way of phenomena.”

original: tshangs pa / gang chos thams cad kyi tshul 'di khong du chud pa'i sems can de dag ni nyung zhing 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshangs pa / gang chos thams cad kyi tshul 'di khong du chud pa'i sems can de dag ni nyung zhing 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He said, “Brahmā, those beings who understand this way of all phenomena are few and will appear.”

original: smras pa / rigs kyi bu /🔽'dod chags dang bral ba'i mtha' ni gcig pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: smras pa / rigs kyi bu / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i mtha' ni gcig pa'ang ma yin /
translated: He said, “Son of noble family,

original: mang po'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: mang po'ang ma yin te /
translated: the limit of freedom from desire is neither one nor many.

original: dra ba can gyi 'od /
analyzed: dra ba can gyi 'od /
translated: Jālinīprabha,

original: rigs kyi bu'am /🔽rigs kyi bu mo gang chos rnams kyi tshul bzhin 'di dag gi rjes su song ba'am /🔽rjes su 'gro ba'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am / rigs kyi bu mo gang chos rnams kyi tshul bzhin 'di dag gi rjes su song ba'am / rjes su 'gro ba'am /
translated: son of noble family,

original: rjes su 'gro bar 'gyur ba de dag gis chos gang yang ma rtogs /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro bar 'gyur ba de dag gis chos gang yang ma rtogs /
translated: or daughter of noble family, who has followed, is following, or will follow this way of phenomena, has not realized any phenomenon.

original: mi rtogs / rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi rtogs / rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not understand, nor will they come to understand.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na; khong du chud pa med par bcom ldan 'das kyis kun shes pa lung bstan pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na; khong du chud pa med par bcom ldan 'das kyis kun shes pa lung bstan pa gsungs so //
translated: Why is that? The Blessed One has taught the prediction of omniscience without any understanding.

original: gang rnams tshul bzhin du chos bstan pa 'di thos nas mos par @50b khyad pa de dag ni ji ltar bstan par de bzhin du rab tu sbyor ba yin te /
analyzed: gang rnams tshul bzhin du chos bstan pa 'di thos nas mos par @50b khyad pa de dag ni ji ltar bstan par de bzhin du rab tu sbyor ba yin te /
translated: Those who, having heard this teaching of the Dharma, develop interest, will apply themselves in accordance with the teaching.

original: de dag ni chos gang la'ang spros par mi byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag ni chos gang la'ang spros par mi byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not conceptualize any phenomena.

original: su chos gang la'ang spros par byed par mi 'gyur ba de dag ni chos gang yang khong du chud par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: su chos gang la'ang spros par byed par mi 'gyur ba de dag ni chos gang yang khong du chud par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who do not conceptualize any phenomena will not understand any phenomena.

original: su chos gang yang khong du chud par mi 'gyur ba de dag ni 'khor bar 'gro ba'ang ma yin /
analyzed: su chos gang yang khong du chud par mi 'gyur ba de dag ni 'khor bar 'gro ba'ang ma yin /
translated: Those who do not understand any phenomena will not go to saṃsāra,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos can yang ma yin no //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos can yang ma yin no //
translated: nor will they be characterized by nirvāṇa.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor ba'ang ma dmigs /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor ba'ang ma dmigs /
translated: The Blessed One has not observed saṃsāra,

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'ang ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'ang ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because even nirvāṇa is not observed.

original: smras pa / bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor ba las bzla ba'i phyir chos ma bshad dam /
analyzed: smras pa / bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor ba las bzla ba'i phyir chos ma bshad dam /
translated: ” He replied, “Has the Blessed One not taught the Dharma in order to transcend saṃsāra?

original: smras pa / bcom ldan 'das kyis gang 'khor ba las bzla ba'i chos gang yang ma bstan tam /
analyzed: smras pa / bcom ldan 'das kyis gang 'khor ba las bzla ba'i chos gang yang ma bstan tam /
translated: ” He replied, “Has the Blessed One not taught any Dharma in order to transcend saṃsāra?

original: smras pa / de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / de ni ma yin no //
translated: ” He replied, “No, he has not.

original: smras pa / rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: smras pa / rigs kyi bu /
translated: ” He said, “Noble son!

original: de lta bas na bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor ba'ang mi sel /
analyzed: de lta bas na bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor ba'ang mi sel /
translated: Therefore, the Blessed One does not eliminate saṃsāra,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'ang thob par mi byed mod kyi /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'ang thob par mi byed mod kyi /
translated: nor does he cause nirvāṇa to be attained.

original: 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis su 'du shes pa las mya ngan las 'da' bar ston te /
analyzed: 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis su 'du shes pa las mya ngan las 'da' bar ston te /
translated: He teaches that one transcends saṃsāra and nirvāṇa by means of the perception of the nonduality of saṃsāra and nirvāṇa.

original: 'di la gang yang 'khor ba las 'da' bar yang mi byed /
analyzed: 'di la gang yang 'khor ba las 'da' bar yang mi byed /
translated: In this regard, he does not cause anyone to transcend saṃsāra,

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'ang 'thob par mi byed do //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'ang 'thob par mi byed do //
translated: nor does he cause anyone to attain nirvāṇa.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mnyam pa nyid ni mi 'khor /🔽mya ngan las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid ni mi 'khor / mya ngan las mi 'da'o //
translated: Equality does not transmigrate,🔽nor does it attain nirvāṇa.

original: kun nas nyon mi mongs /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mi mongs /
translated: It is not afflicted,

original: rnam par byang bar mi 'gyur @51a *//
analyzed: rnam par byang bar mi 'gyur @51a *//
translated: they will not be purified.

original: ro; ;de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshangs pa khyad par sems la legs so zhes bya ba byin te /🔽tshangs pa / legs so //
analyzed: ro; ;de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshangs pa khyad par sems la legs so zhes bya ba byin te / tshangs pa / legs so //
translated: Then the Bhagavān said to Brahma­viśeṣacintin, “Excellent!🔽Brahmā, excellent!

original: legs so // tshangs pa /
analyzed: legs so // tshangs pa /
translated: Brahmā,

original: ci ste bshad par bya na de skad bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: ci ste bshad par bya na de skad bshad par bya'o //
translated: if you are going to explain, then explain in that way.

original: tshul bzhin du chos bstan pa 'di bstan pa na dge slong nyis stong rnams zag pa las len pa med par sems rnam par grol lo //
analyzed: tshul bzhin du chos bstan pa 'di bstan pa na dge slong nyis stong rnams zag pa las len pa med par sems rnam par grol lo //
translated: When this Dharma teaching of proper conduct was explained, two thousand monks became free of grasping at all phenomena.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshangs pa khyad par sems la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshangs pa khyad par sems la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the Bhagavān said to Brahma­viśeṣacintin, “Brahmā,

original: tshangs pa / ngas 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa ma dmigs so //
analyzed: tshangs pa / ngas 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa ma dmigs so //
translated: I do not apprehend saṃsāra or nirvāṇa.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na; de bzhin gshegs pa 'khor bar 'dogs kyang 'di la gang yang 'khor ba med do //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na; de bzhin gshegs pa 'khor bar 'dogs kyang 'di la gang yang 'khor ba med do //
translated: Why is that? Although the Tathāgata designates saṃsāra, there is no saṃsāra here at all.

original: mya ngan las 'das par ston kyang 'di la gang yang yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das par ston kyang 'di la gang yang yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da'o //
translated: Although nirvāṇa is taught, there is no one here who attains nirvāṇa.

original: tshangs pa / gang rnams tshul 'di la zhugs pa de dag ni 'khor ba'i chos can yang ma yin /
analyzed: tshangs pa / gang rnams tshul 'di la zhugs pa de dag ni 'khor ba'i chos can yang ma yin /
translated: Brahmā, those who enter this way are not subject to the phenomena of saṃsāra,

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can yang ma yin no //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can yang ma yin no //
translated: and they are not subject to the phenomena of complete nirvāṇa.

original: de nas 'khor de'i nang nas dge slong lnga brgya bstan pa 'di thos pa dang / stan las langs te dong ngo //
analyzed: de nas 'khor de'i nang nas dge slong lnga brgya bstan pa 'di thos pa dang / stan las langs te dong ngo //
translated: Then, from within the assembly, five hundred monks rose from their seats when they heard this teaching and left.

original: tshig 'di skad ces kyang smras te /
analyzed: tshig 'di skad ces kyang smras te /
translated: They said these words:

original: gal te 'di la gang yang mi 'khor /
analyzed: gal te 'di la gang yang mi 'khor /
translated: “If no one enters saṃsāra,

original: gal te gang yang yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' na /
analyzed: gal te gang yang yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' na /
translated: and no one attains complete nirvāṇa,

original: bdag cag tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa'ang don med do //
analyzed: bdag cag tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa'ang don med do //
translated: then it is pointless for us to abide in pure conduct.

original: bdag cag lam sgom pa dang / bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms @51b bar 'jug pa'ang ci dgos zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bdag cag lam sgom pa dang / bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms @51b bar 'jug pa'ang ci dgos zhes zer ro //
translated: What is the point of our cultivating the path, or of our meditative concentration, absorption, and equipoise?”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la gzhon nur gyur pa dra ba can gyi 'od kyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la gzhon nur gyur pa dra ba can gyi 'od kyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the youth Jālinīprabha said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: gang dag chos gang la skye ba'am /
analyzed: gang dag chos gang la skye ba'am /
translated: those who do not generate any phenomena

original: 'gag par 'tshal ba de dag la sangs rgyas 'byung ba ma mchis so //
analyzed: 'gag par 'tshal ba de dag la sangs rgyas 'byung ba ma mchis so //
translated: For those who seek cessation, there is no arising of the Buddha.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: gang dag mya ngan las 'das pa dngos por 'tshol ba de dag la'ang 'khor ba las 'da' ba ma mchis so //
analyzed: gang dag mya ngan las 'das pa dngos por 'tshol ba de dag la'ang 'khor ba las 'da' ba ma mchis so //
translated: for those who seek nirvāṇa as a thing, there is no transcendence of cyclic existence.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bgyi ba ni gang mtshan ma thams cad rab tu zhi ba dang / g-yo ba thams cad ma mchis par gyur pa lags na /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bgyi ba ni gang mtshan ma thams cad rab tu zhi ba dang / g-yo ba thams cad ma mchis par gyur pa lags na /
translated: what is called nirvāṇa is the complete pacification of all characteristics and the absence of all movement.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: skyes bu blun po 'di dag legs par bshad pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung nas mu stegs can gyi lta bar lhung ste mya ngan las 'das pa dngos por 'tshol lo //
analyzed: skyes bu blun po 'di dag legs par bshad pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung nas mu stegs can gyi lta bar lhung ste mya ngan las 'das pa dngos por 'tshol lo //
translated: these foolish people, having gone forth in the well-taught Dharma and Vinaya, fall into the views of the tīrthikas and seek nirvāṇa as a thing.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: til las til mar dang / 'o ma las mar bzhin du chos thams cas shin tu mya ngan las 'das pa la gang rnams mya ngan las 'das pa la dngos por 'tshol ba de dag ni nyan thos mu stegs can nga rgyal can zhes bdag mchi'o //
analyzed: til las til mar dang / 'o ma las mar bzhin du chos thams cas shin tu mya ngan las 'das pa la gang rnams mya ngan las 'das pa la dngos por 'tshol ba de dag ni nyan thos mu stegs can nga rgyal can zhes bdag mchi'o //
translated: Just as sesame oil is extracted from sesame seeds and butter from milk, so too, in the case of all phenomena, those who seek for nirvana as a thing are called by me to be arrogant śrāvakas and tīrthikas.

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽rnal 'byor spyod pa yang dag par zhugs pa'i chos gang la'ang skye ba'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / rnal 'byor spyod pa yang dag par zhugs pa'i chos gang la'ang skye ba'am /
translated: Blessed One,

original: 'gag par mi mthong /🔽chos gang la'ang 'thob pa'am /
analyzed: 'gag par mi mthong / chos gang la'ang 'thob pa'am /
translated: those who are engaged in the practice of yoga do not see any phenomenon as arising or ceasing.

original: mthong par rtogs par mi 'tshal lo //🔽de nas gzhon nur gyur pa dra ba can @52a *//
analyzed: mthong par rtogs par mi 'tshal lo // de nas gzhon nur gyur pa dra ba can @52a *//
translated: They do not seek to attain or realize any phenomenon.

original: gyi 'od kyis tshangs pa khyad par sems la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: gyi 'od kyis tshangs pa khyad par sems la 'di skad ces smras so //

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //

analyzed: lus ni rnam par dag cing sdig pa mi byed de //

analyzed: ngag kyang rnam par dag pas rtag tu rdzun rnams spangs //

original: yid kyang gtsang bas rtag tu bsam pa dri ma med //
analyzed: yid kyang gtsang bas rtag tu bsam pa dri ma med //

analyzed: mi sdug sgom zhing 'dod chags kyis kyang chags pa med //

analyzed: byams la gnas shing zhe sdang gis ni gtum pa med //

original: shes rab dag la gnas shing gti mug blun ma yin //
analyzed: shes rab dag la gnas shing gti mug blun ma yin //

original: mkhas pa rnams ni de la kun tu 'gro bar gsungs //
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams ni de la kun tu 'gro bar gsungs //

original: de ni grong du ci bzhin de bzhin sgom pa yang //
analyzed: de ni grong du ci bzhin de bzhin sgom pa yang //

original: dgon pa dang ni grong dang 'khor du de 'dra bar //
analyzed: dgon pa dang ni grong dang 'khor du de 'dra bar //
translated: In the wilderness, in the village, in the royal court, they are the same.

original: de ni spyod lam rnam par 'gyur ba @55b ma byed de //
analyzed: de ni spyod lam rnam par 'gyur ba @55b ma byed de //

original: de phyir rgyal bas de la kun tu 'gro bar brjod //
analyzed: de phyir rgyal bas de la kun tu 'gro bar brjod //
translated: Therefore, the Victorious One has said that they are everywhere.

original: rgyal ba kun gyi chos nyid la ni de mos te //
analyzed: rgyal ba kun gyi chos nyid la ni de mos te //

analyzed: mkhas pas chos nyid la yang 'dod chags bral ba dang // dge 'dun la yang 'dus ma byas par shin tu mos //

original: de phyir rgyal ba rnams kyis kun tu 'gro bar gsungs //
analyzed: de phyir rgyal ba rnams kyis kun tu 'gro bar gsungs //

original: 'dod chags mos pa dag gi spyod pa rab tu shes //
analyzed: 'dod chags mos pa dag gi spyod pa rab tu shes //

analyzed: zhe sdang mos pa rnams dang de bzhin gti mug dang // spyod pa rnam par 'gyur ba la yang de mkhas te //

original: de phyir de ni rgyal bas kun tu 'gro bar bstan //
analyzed: de phyir de ni rgyal bas kun tu 'gro bar bstan //
translated: Therefore the Victorious Ones have taught it to be all-pervading.

original: 'dod pa'i khams la shin tu gnas par mi byed de //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams la shin tu gnas par mi byed de //

original: gzugs kyi khams la yang ni gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams la yang ni gnas par mi 'gyur ro //

original: de ni gzugs med pa yi khams la mi gnas te //
analyzed: de ni gzugs med pa yi khams la mi gnas te //
translated: They do not remain in the formless realm,

original: de phyir de ni rgyal bas kun tu 'gro bar brjod //
analyzed: de phyir de ni rgyal bas kun tu 'gro bar brjod //
translated: And therefore the Victorious Ones have taught it to be all-pervading.🔽They are always free from the accumulation of signs and wishes,

original: rtag tu mtshan ma dang ni smon pas gsog gyur dang // dngos po thams cad stong pa nyid du de mos te //
analyzed: rtag tu mtshan ma dang ni smon pas gsog gyur dang // dngos po thams cad stong pa nyid du de mos te //
translated: And they are interested in the emptiness of all things.

original: zag pa rnams ni bar du zad par mi byed de //
analyzed: zag pa rnams ni bar du zad par mi byed de //
translated: They do not eliminate the defilements in the interim,

original: de phyir de ni rgyal bas kun tu 'gro bar bstan //
analyzed: de phyir de ni rgyal bas kun tu 'gro bar bstan //
translated: And therefore the Victorious Ones have taught it to be all-pervading.

original: de ni rang rgyal theg pa la yang mkhas pa yin //
analyzed: de ni rang rgyal theg pa la yang mkhas pa yin //

original: sgra phyir 'brang ba nyan thos 'gyur ba'ang de yis shes //
analyzed: sgra phyir 'brang ba nyan thos 'gyur ba'ang de yis shes //

analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas theg pa'i pha rol song ba yin //

analyzed: de phyir bde bar gshegs pas kun tu 'gro bar brjod //

original: de dag rtag par kun tu blo gros dri ma med //
analyzed: de dag rtag par kun tu blo gros dri ma med //

original: de dag tshul dang tshul ma yin la mi rmongs te //🔽mdza' ba dang ni mi @56a *//
analyzed: de dag tshul dang tshul ma yin la mi rmongs te // mdza' ba dang ni mi @56a *//

original: mdza' ba la mnyam pa'i yid //
analyzed: mdza' ba la mnyam pa'i yid //
translated: and those who are not friends.

original: de phyir byang chub sems dpa' kun tu 'gro ba yin //
analyzed: de phyir byang chub sems dpa' kun tu 'gro ba yin //

original: 'das pa dag gi chos la'ang rnam par mi rtog cing //
analyzed: 'das pa dag gi chos la'ang rnam par mi rtog cing //

original: ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar gyi la'ang de bzhin te //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar gyi la'ang de bzhin te //

analyzed: thams cad du yang dpa' po rnam par mi rtog spyod //

analyzed: de phyir sems can dag pa kun tu 'gro ba'o //// bam po gnyis pa /

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshangs pa khyad par sems kyis 'di skad ces gsol to //

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'jig rten gyi chos rnams las shin tu 'da'/

analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chos kyi nang na'ang gda' la 'jig rten gyi chos rnams kyis kyang mi gos /

analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chos kyi 'jug pa'ang rab tu 'tshal la 'jig rten gyi chos kyi 'jug par yang mi mchi /

analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chos kyi 'jug pas kyang sems can rnams 'jig rten gyi chos las yongs su thar bar bgyid /
translated: They liberate beings from worldly dharmas through the engagement of worldly dharmas.

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshangs pa khyad par sems la tshigs su bcad pa dag gis slar bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: 'jig rten chos las rnam par grol //

original: byang chub sems dpa' mkhas pa der //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mkhas pa der //

analyzed: phung po rnams dang rab ldan yang //

analyzed: 'jig rten chos dang ldan pa yi //

analyzed: shes rab chen po brten de rnams //

original: 'jig rten chos rnams rab rtogs shing //
analyzed: 'jig rten chos rnams rab rtogs shing //

analyzed: ma rnyed pas kyang ngoms pa med //
translated: and are not satisfied with non-gain.

original: ri rab bzhin du mthu brtan pa //
analyzed: ri rab bzhin du mthu brtan pa //

original: rnam pa kun tu gnod mi 'gyur //
analyzed: rnam pa kun tu gnod mi 'gyur //

analyzed: de bzhin grags dang ma grags kyang //
translated: Likewise, with fame and lack of fame,

original: rtag tu mtshungs par 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: rtag tu mtshungs par 'gyur ba yin //

analyzed: bde dang sdug bsngal bstod smad la // mnyam pa nyid du gnas par 'gyur //
translated: In happiness and suffering, in praise and blame.

analyzed: 'jig rten 'di ni gnyis las byung //

analyzed: phyin ci log las kun tu langs //

analyzed: de phyir 'jig rten 'gro rtogs nas //

analyzed: mkhas pa rnams ni 'gro med 'gro / 'jig rten 'di 'gro gang yin pa //

analyzed: dpa' bo de dag 'jig rten spyod //

original: 'du shes gnyis la gang gnas pa //

analyzed: 'di bden 'di ni rdzun no zhes //

analyzed: mi mkhas de dag rtsod par 'gyur //

analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten chos rnams kyi //

analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
