original: bshad kyang snang ba'i gzugs ma lags /
analyzed: bshad kyang snang ba'i gzugs ma lags /
translated: Even though it is explained, it is not a visible form.

original: kun mkhyen kyang rnam par mkhyen pa ma mchis /
analyzed: kun mkhyen kyang rnam par mkhyen pa ma mchis /
translated: Even though it is omniscient, there is no omniscience.

original: bsgom kyang gnyis su ma bgyis //
analyzed: bsgom kyang gnyis su ma bgyis //
translated: Even though it is cultivated, it is not dual.

original: mngon du bgyis kyang thob par ma mchis //
analyzed: mngon du bgyis kyang thob par ma mchis //
translated: Even though it is realized, it is not attained.

original: mya ngan las bzlas kyang zhi ba'ang ma mchis te /
analyzed: mya ngan las bzlas kyang zhi ba'ang ma mchis te /
translated: Even though it is beyond suffering, there is no peace.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: those sons of good family

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang rnams chos kyi tshul gyi rnam pa 'di la mos pa de dag ni lta bar gyur pa thams cad las rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang rnams chos kyi tshul gyi rnam pa 'di la mos pa de dag ni lta bar gyur pa thams cad las rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: who are devoted to this aspect of the way of the Dharma will be liberated from all views.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la bsnyen bkur bgyis @63a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la bsnyen bkur bgyis @63a *//
translated: They have served the Tathāgata

original: shing sngon gyi rgyal ba la lhag par bgyi ba bgyis pa lags so //
analyzed: shing sngon gyi rgyal ba la lhag par bgyi ba bgyis pa lags so //
translated: and have done what is to be done for the victors of the past.

original: de dag dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung ba lags so //
analyzed: de dag dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung ba lags so //
translated: They have been taken up by a spiritual friend.

original: de dag dge ba'i rtsa ba 'bar ba'i slad du rgya chen po las mos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag dge ba'i rtsa ba 'bar ba'i slad du rgya chen po las mos par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be devoted to the vast, in order to make the roots of virtue blaze.

original: de dag de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzod 'chang ba'i slad du gter rab tu rnyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzod 'chang ba'i slad du gter rab tu rnyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will find a treasure, in order to hold the treasure of the Tathāgata.

original: de dag legs bar bgyi ba'i las bgyid pa'i slad du las kyi mtha' shin tu mthun par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag legs bar bgyi ba'i las bgyid pa'i slad du las kyi mtha' shin tu mthun par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will have very compatible karma, in order to do good karma.

original: de dag sangs rgyas kyi rigs 'dzin pa'i slad du rigs btsun par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag sangs rgyas kyi rigs 'dzin pa'i slad du rigs btsun par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will have a good family, in order to hold the family of the Buddha.

original: de dag nyon mongs pa thams cad yongs su btang ba'i slad du gtong ba chen po dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag nyon mongs pa thams cad yongs su btang ba'i slad du gtong ba chen po dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will have great generosity, in order to give up all afflictions.

original: de dag tshul khrims kyi stobs dang ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag tshul khrims kyi stobs dang ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: They will have the power of morality,

original: nyon mongs pa'i stobs can ma lags /🔽lus srog por ba'i slad du de dag bzod pa'i stobs can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i stobs can ma lags / lus srog por ba'i slad du de dag bzod pa'i stobs can du 'gyur ro //
translated: not the power of afflictions.🔽They will have the power of patience, in order to give up body and life.

original: de dag yid yongs su skyo ba ma mchis pa'i slad du brtson 'grus kyi stobs can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag yid yongs su skyo ba ma mchis pa'i slad du brtson 'grus kyi stobs can du 'gyur ro //
translated: They will have the power of effort, in order to not be discouraged.

original: de dag sdig pa'i las bsregs pa'i slad du bsam gtan gyi stobs can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag sdig pa'i las bsregs pa'i slad du bsam gtan gyi stobs can du 'gyur ro //
translated: They will have the power of concentration in order to burn away their evil karma.

original: de dag sdig par lta ba rnams dang bral ba'i slad du shes rab kyi stobs can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag sdig par lta ba rnams dang bral ba'i slad du shes rab kyi stobs can du 'gyur ro //
translated: They will have the power of wisdom in order to be free from evil views.

original: de dag bdud rnams kyis rab tu thub par dka' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag bdud rnams kyis rab tu thub par dka' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be difficult for the māras to overcome.

original: de dag phyir rgol ba rnams kyis mi rdzi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag phyir rgol ba rnams kyis mi rdzi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be unassailable by adversaries.

original: de dag de bzhin gshegs pa rnams @63b la mi slu bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag de bzhin gshegs pa rnams @63b la mi slu bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not deceive the tathāgatas.

original: de dag chos kyi rang bzhin ston pa la mkhas pa'i slad du yang dag par smra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag chos kyi rang bzhin ston pa la mkhas pa'i slad du yang dag par smra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be truthful because they are skilled in teaching the nature of phenomena.

original: de dag don dam pa'i chos ston pa'i slad du bden par smra bar 'gyur ro; ;de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis yongs su gzung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag don dam pa'i chos ston pa'i slad du bden par smra bar 'gyur ro; ;de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis yongs su gzung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be truthful because they teach the ultimate Dharma. They will be accepted by the tathāgatas.

original: de dag 'grogs na bde ba'i slad du nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag 'grogs na bde ba'i slad du nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be agreeable because they are pleasant to be with.

original: de dag 'phags pa'i nor rnams kyi nor dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag 'phags pa'i nor rnams kyi nor dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be wealthy because they possess the wealth of the noble ones.

original: de dag 'phags pa'i rigs rnams kyis mchog 'tshal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag 'phags pa'i rigs rnams kyis mchog 'tshal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be the supreme object of worship for the noble ones.

original: gso sla zhing dgang sla bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gso sla zhing dgang sla bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be easy to support and easy to fill.

original: de dag pha rol tu mchi ba'i slad du dbugs 'byin pa thob par 'gyur ro //🔽de dag ma brgal ba rnams sgrol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag pha rol tu mchi ba'i slad du dbugs 'byin pa thob par 'gyur ro // de dag ma brgal ba rnams sgrol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will obtain relief for the sake of reaching the other shore.🔽They will liberate those who have not crossed over.

original: de dag ma grol ba rnams grol bar bgyid par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag ma grol ba rnams grol bar bgyid par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will free those who are not free.

original: de dag dbugs 'byin pa ma mchis pa rnams kyi dbugs 'byin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag dbugs 'byin pa ma mchis pa rnams kyi dbugs 'byin par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will give relief to those who have no relief.

original: yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das pa rnams yongs su mya ngan las zlo bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das pa rnams yongs su mya ngan las zlo bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will bring to complete nirvāṇa those who have not attained complete nirvāṇa.

original: de dag lam ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag lam ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will show the path.

original: de dag mya ngan las 'das pa ston par 'gyur ro //🔽de dag sman thams cad yongs su 'tshal ba'i slad du sman pa rnams kyi rgyal por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag mya ngan las 'das pa ston par 'gyur ro // de dag sman thams cad yongs su 'tshal ba'i slad du sman pa rnams kyi rgyal por 'gyur ro //
translated: They will show nirvāṇa.🔽They will become the kings of physicians because they know all medicines.

original: de dag nad thams cad rab tu zhi bar bgyid pa'i slad du sman lta bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag nad thams cad rab tu zhi bar bgyid pa'i slad du sman lta bur 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be like medicine because they pacify all illnesses.

original: de dag ye shes kyi stobs dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag ye shes kyi stobs dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will have the power of wisdom.

original: de dag mthus spro ba dang ldan par 'gyur ro //🔽de dag gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog pa'i slad du @64a *//
analyzed: de dag mthus spro ba dang ldan par 'gyur ro // de dag gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog pa'i slad du @64a *//
translated: They will be diligent through the power of their strength.

original: rtsal dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtsal dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be strong because they are not dependent on others.

original: de dag 'jigs pas spu ldang ba ma mchis pa'i slad du seng ge lta bur 'gyur ro //🔽de dag cang shes pa'i slad du ba glang lta bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag 'jigs pas spu ldang ba ma mchis pa'i slad du seng ge lta bur 'gyur ro // de dag cang shes pa'i slad du ba glang lta bur 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be like lions because they are fearless.🔽They will be like bulls because they are well-bred.

original: de dag sems rab tu dul ba'i slad du glang po cher 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag sems rab tu dul ba'i slad du glang po cher 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be like elephants because they have well-trained minds.

original: de dag 'khor mang po yongs su sdud pa'i slad du khyu mchog tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag 'khor mang po yongs su sdud pa'i slad du khyu mchog tu 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be like bulls because they gather a great retinue.

original: de dag bdud dang phyir rgol ba rnams rab tu bcom pa'i slad du dpa' bor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag bdud dang phyir rgol ba rnams rab tu bcom pa'i slad du dpa' bor 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be heroes because they have defeated Māra and his followers.

original: de dag 'khor gyis 'jigs pa ma mchis pa'i slad du brtan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag 'khor gyis 'jigs pa ma mchis pa'i slad du brtan par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be steadfast because they are fearless in the midst of the assembly.

original: de dag mi 'jigs pa thob pa'i slad du mi thub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag mi 'jigs pa thob pa'i slad du mi thub par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be invincible because they have attained fearlessness.

original: de dag bden pa bstan pa rnams la 'jigs pa ma mchis par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag bden pa bstan pa rnams la 'jigs pa ma mchis par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be fearless in teaching the truth.

original: de dag dkar po'i phyogs yongs su rgyas pa'i slad du zla ba dang mtshungs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag dkar po'i phyogs yongs su rgyas pa'i slad du zla ba dang mtshungs par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be like the moon, because they will be fully developed in virtue.

original: de dag shes rab kyi snang bar bgyid pas nyi ma lta bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag shes rab kyi snang bar bgyid pas nyi ma lta bur 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be like the sun, because they will shine with wisdom.

original: de dag mun pa chen po dang bral ba'i slad du sgron me lta bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag mun pa chen po dang bral ba'i slad du sgron me lta bur 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be like lamps, because they will be free from great darkness.

original: de dag mdza' ba dang / khong khro ba ma mchis pa'i slad du gzhi rten lta bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag mdza' ba dang / khong khro ba ma mchis pa'i slad du gzhi rten lta bur 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be like the earth, because they will be impartial and free from anger.

original: de dag sems can thams cad nye bar 'tsho ba'i slad du sa dang mtshungs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag sems can thams cad nye bar 'tsho ba'i slad du sa dang mtshungs par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be like the earth, because they will be the support of all beings.

original: de dag chos thams cad la mi gnas pa'i slad du rlung dang mtshungs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag chos thams cad la mi gnas pa'i slad du rlung dang mtshungs par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be like the wind, because they will not dwell on anything.

original: de dag nyon mongs pa'i dri ma thams cad 'khru ba'i slad du chu dang mtshungs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag nyon mongs pa'i dri ma thams cad 'khru ba'i slad du chu dang mtshungs par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be like water, because they will wash away all the stains of the afflictions.

original: de @64b dag rlom sems thams cad yang dag par 'joms pa'i slad du me dang mtshungs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de @64b dag rlom sems thams cad yang dag par 'joms pa'i slad du me dang mtshungs par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be like fire, in order to completely destroy all pride.

original: de dag bskyod mi nus pa'i slad du ri rab dang mtshungs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag bskyod mi nus pa'i slad du ri rab dang mtshungs par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be like Mount Meru, in order to be unshakable.

original: de dag lhag pa'i bsam pa brtan zhing mi phyed pa'i slad du rdo rje ltar sra ba'i khor yug gi ri lta bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag lhag pa'i bsam pa brtan zhing mi phyed pa'i slad du rdo rje ltar sra ba'i khor yug gi ri lta bur 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be like the Cakravāḍa mountain range, in order to have a firm, unbreakable resolve.

original: de dag phas kyi rgol ba thams cad kyis gdul dka' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag phas kyi rgol ba thams cad kyis gdul dka' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be difficult to subdue for all adversaries.

original: de dag nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis gting dbag dka' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis gting dbag dka' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be difficult to fathom for all the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: de dag chos rin po che thams cad 'du ba'i slad du rgya mtsho lta bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag chos rin po che thams cad 'du ba'i slad du rgya mtsho lta bur 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be like the ocean, in order to gather all the jewels of the Dharma.

original: de dag nyon mongs pa thams cad bas pa'i slad du gting dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag nyon mongs pa thams cad bas pa'i slad du gting dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be like the depths, in order to be beyond all afflictions.

original: de dag chos yongs su 'tshol bas chog mi shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag chos yongs su 'tshol bas chog mi shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be insatiable in their pursuit of the Dharma.

original: de dag shes rab kyis ngoms par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag shes rab kyis ngoms par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be satisfied with wisdom.

original: de dag chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor bas rgyal po dang mtshungs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor bas rgyal po dang mtshungs par 'gyur ro //
translated: They are like kings because they turn the wheel of the Dharma.

original: de dag gzugs 'dzin pa'i slad du brgya byin dang mtshungs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gzugs 'dzin pa'i slad du brgya byin dang mtshungs par 'gyur ro //
translated: They are like Śakra because they hold the form of Śakra.

original: de dag dbang bsgyur ba'i slad du tshangs pa dang mtshungs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag dbang bsgyur ba'i slad du tshangs pa dang mtshungs par 'gyur ro //
translated: They are like Brahmā because they are in control.

original: de dag chos mngon par sgrogs pa'i slad du sprin dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag chos mngon par sgrogs pa'i slad du sprin dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They are like clouds because they proclaim the Abhidharma.

original: de dag bdud rtsi'i char rab tu 'bebs pa'i slad du char dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag bdud rtsi'i char rab tu 'bebs pa'i slad du char dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They are like rain because they rain down the rain of immortality.

original: de dag dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams rnam par 'phel bar bgyid par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams rnam par 'phel bar bgyid par 'gyur ro //
translated: They increase the faculties, powers, and branches of awakening.

original: de dag 'khor ba'i 'dam las brgal @65a *//🔽bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag 'khor ba'i 'dam las brgal @65a *// bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They cross over the swamp of saṃsāra.

original: de dag sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la zhugs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la zhugs par 'gyur ro //
translated: They enter the wisdom of the buddhas.

original: de dag sangs rgyas kyi byang chub la nye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag sangs rgyas kyi byang chub la nye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They approach the awakening of the buddhas.

original: de dag blos mnyam pa ma mchis par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag blos mnyam pa ma mchis par 'gyur ro //
translated: They become unequaled in their intellect.

original: de dag thos pas mi mnyam pa dang mnyam par 'gyur ro //🔽de dag gzhal ba las 'das pa'i slad du mtshungs pa ma mchis par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag thos pas mi mnyam pa dang mnyam par 'gyur ro // de dag gzhal ba las 'das pa'i slad du mtshungs pa ma mchis par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be equal to the unequalled.🔽They will be incomparable because they are beyond measure.

original: de dag spobs pas thogs pa ma mchis par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag spobs pas thogs pa ma mchis par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be unimpeded in eloquence.

original: de dag gzungs rab tu thob pa'i slad du dran pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gzungs rab tu thob pa'i slad du dran pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will have mindfulness because they have attained dhāraṇī.

original: de dag don rtogs pa'i slad du 'brang bas rtogs pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag don rtogs pa'i slad du 'brang bas rtogs pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will have understanding through following because they have realized the meaning.

original: de dag chos la tshul bzhin du so sor rtog pa'i slad du blo gros dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag chos la tshul bzhin du so sor rtog pa'i slad du blo gros dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will have intelligence because they have investigated phenomena properly.🔽They will be skilled in the thoughts of sentient beings.

original: de dag sems can gyi bsam pa rnams la mkhas par 'gyur ro; ;de dag 'jig rten la phan par bgyi ba'i slad du brtson par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag sems can gyi bsam pa rnams la mkhas par 'gyur ro; ;de dag 'jig rten la phan par bgyi ba'i slad du brtson par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be diligent in benefiting the world.

original: de dag 'jig rten las 'phags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag 'jig rten las 'phags par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be exalted above the world.

original: de dag pad mo lta bur mi chags par 'gyur ro; ;de dag 'jig rten gyi chos rnams kyis yongs su ma zin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag pad mo lta bur mi chags par 'gyur ro; ;de dag 'jig rten gyi chos rnams kyis yongs su ma zin par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be unstained like a lotus. They will not be caught up in worldly phenomena.

original: de dag mkhas pa rnams dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag mkhas pa rnams dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The wise will delight in them.

original: de dag mang du thos pa rnams kyis cher bkur bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag mang du thos pa rnams kyis cher bkur bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be greatly revered by the learned.

original: de dag rig pa rnams kyis ri mo bgyi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag rig pa rnams kyis ri mo bgyi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The wise will honor them.

original: de dag lha dang / mi rnams kyis mchod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag lha dang / mi rnams kyis mchod par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be worshipped by gods and humans.

original: de dag 'jig rten rnams kyis phyag bgyi bar @65b 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag 'jig rten rnams kyis phyag bgyi bar @65b 'gyur ro //
translated: The world will bow to them.

original: de dag 'phags pa rnams kyi bkur sti bgyi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag 'phags pa rnams kyi bkur sti bgyi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The noble ones will honor them.

original: de dag nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis smon par bgyid par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis smon par bgyid par 'gyur ro //
translated: The hearers and solitary buddhas will aspire to them.

original: de dag nyi tsher spyod pa la re ba ma mchis par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag nyi tsher spyod pa la re ba ma mchis par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not have any hope for limited practice.

original: de dag chags pa ma mchis pa'i slad du tshul mi chos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag chags pa ma mchis pa'i slad du tshul mi chos par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be irreproachable because they are free from attachment.

original: de dag spyod lam mdzes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag spyod lam mdzes par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will have a beautiful demeanor.

original: de dag gzugs blta na sdug par 'gyur ro; ;de dag gzi brjid kyis yid chags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gzugs blta na sdug par 'gyur ro; ;de dag gzi brjid kyis yid chags par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will have a pleasing appearance. They will captivate the mind with their splendor.

original: de dag mtshan rnams kyis brgyan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag mtshan rnams kyis brgyan par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be adorned with the major marks.

original: de dag dpe byad bzang po rnams kyis rnam par spras par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag dpe byad bzang po rnams kyis rnam par spras par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be adorned with the excellent minor marks.

original: de dag sangs rgyas kyi rigs yang dag par 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag sangs rgyas kyi rigs yang dag par 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will uphold the family of the Buddha.

original: de dag chos kyi rigs yongs su bsrung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag chos kyi rigs yongs su bsrung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will protect the family of the Dharma.

original: de dag dge 'dun gyi rigs kun tu bsrung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag dge 'dun gyi rigs kun tu bsrung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will guard the family of the Saṅgha.

original: de dag ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyis gzigs so //
analyzed: de dag ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyis gzigs so //
translated: They will be seen by all the buddhas.

original: de dag gis chos kyi spyan rab tu thob bo //
analyzed: de dag gis chos kyi spyan rab tu thob bo //
translated: They will attain the eye of Dharma.

original: de dag sangs rgyas kyi ye shes su lung bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag sangs rgyas kyi ye shes su lung bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be prophesied to attain the wisdom of the buddhas.

original: de dag gi bzod pa gsum yongs su rdzogs par bgyis so //
analyzed: de dag gi bzod pa gsum yongs su rdzogs par bgyis so //
translated: They will perfect the three kinds of patience.

original: de dag byang chub kyi snying po yongs su rdzogs pa la gnas so //
analyzed: de dag byang chub kyi snying po yongs su rdzogs pa la gnas so //
translated: They will be established in the perfection of the essence of awakening.

original: de dag gis bdud kyi sde rab tu bcom mo //
analyzed: de dag gis bdud kyi sde rab tu bcom mo //
translated: They will conquer the armies of Māra.

original: de dag thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob bo //
analyzed: de dag thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob bo //
translated: They will attain omniscience.

original: de dag chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will turn the wheel of the Dharma.

original: de dag bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa bgyid par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa bgyid par 'gyur te /
translated: They will perform the deeds of the Buddha.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: gang chos kyi tshul zab mo 'di @66a *//
analyzed: gang chos kyi tshul zab mo 'di @66a *//
translated: those who hear this profound Dharma way

original: thos nas mi skrag /
analyzed: thos nas mi skrag /
translated: and are not frightened,🔽not terrified, and not terrified in terror,

original: mi dngang / shin tu dngang bar mi 'gyur ba dang / gang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi byang chub 'di ltar zab pa /
analyzed: mi dngang / shin tu dngang bar mi 'gyur ba dang / gang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi byang chub 'di ltar zab pa /
translated: and those who, having heard this profound awakening of the thus-gone ones,

original: 'di ltar zhes  dka' ba; 'di ltar blta dka' ba /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes  dka' ba; 'di ltar blta dka' ba /
translated: this which is so difficult to see,

original: 'di ltar khong du chud par dka' ba 'di thos nas mos par 'gyur ba dang / 'dzin par 'gyur ba dang / 'chang bar 'gyur ba dang / gzhan la'ang rgyas par bgyid par 'gyur ba dang / chos 'di la rab tu zhugs shing gzhan yang nan tan la 'god par bgyid pa'i skyes bu dam pa de dag gi bsngags pa bskal pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar khong du chud par dka' ba 'di thos nas mos par 'gyur ba dang / 'dzin par 'gyur ba dang / 'chang bar 'gyur ba dang / gzhan la'ang rgyas par bgyid par 'gyur ba dang / chos 'di la rab tu zhugs shing gzhan yang nan tan la 'god par bgyid pa'i skyes bu dam pa de dag gi bsngags pa bskal pa'am /
translated: this which is so difficult to understand, will be inspired by it, will uphold it, will keep it, will spread it to others, and will engage with this Dharma and establish others in it as well—Blessed One, if I were to praise those holy beings for eons or more than eons,

original: bskal pa las lhag par brjod cing yon tan yongs su bsgrags kyang /
analyzed: bskal pa las lhag par brjod cing yon tan yongs su bsgrags kyang /
translated: declaring their qualities,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: bdag gis skyes bu dam pa de dag gi yon tan mthar mi phyin to; ;bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽tshangs pa / khyod kyis skyes bu de dag gi bsngags pa'am /
analyzed: bdag gis skyes bu dam pa de dag gi yon tan mthar mi phyin to; ;bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / tshangs pa / khyod kyis skyes bu de dag gi bsngags pa'am /
translated: The Bhagavān said,🔽“Brahmā, how much do you know about the praise or

original: yon tan ji tsam du shes /
analyzed: yon tan ji tsam du shes /
translated: good qualities of those beings?”

original: tshangs pas gsol pa /
analyzed: tshangs pas gsol pa /
translated: Brahmā said,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas zag pa ma mchis pa'i sangs rgyas kyi ye shes ji snyed pa mkhyen pa dang / de dag gi yon tan de dag dang / de las lhag par yang 'tshal bar bgyi ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas zag pa ma mchis pa'i sangs rgyas kyi ye shes ji snyed pa mkhyen pa dang / de dag gi yon tan de dag dang / de las lhag par yang 'tshal bar bgyi ste /
translated: “The Tathāgata knows the extent of the uncontaminated buddha knowledge, and those good qualities and more.

original: gang de bzhin gshegs pas bshad pa'i don dang / tshig dang / yi ge bzang po rnams rtogs par rig pa dang / ldem po dag 'tshal ba dang / mthun par bgyid cing 'gal @66b par mi bgyid pa dang / yang dag par sbyor zhing sun 'byin par mi bgyid pa dang /
analyzed: gang de bzhin gshegs pas bshad pa'i don dang / tshig dang / yi ge bzang po rnams rtogs par rig pa dang / ldem po dag 'tshal ba dang / mthun par bgyid cing 'gal @66b par mi bgyid pa dang / yang dag par sbyor zhing sun 'byin par mi bgyid pa dang /
translated: Those who understand the meaning, words, and good letters that the Tathāgata teaches, who know the indirect teachings, who agree and do not disagree, who apply themselves and do not criticize,

original: don rtogs par rig cing yi ge'i phyir mi snyegs pa de dag ni brjod pa gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams chos gsungs pa dang / ldem po dag gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa chos gsungs pa dang / thabs gang dang / tshul gang dang /
analyzed: don rtogs par rig cing yi ge'i phyir mi snyegs pa de dag ni brjod pa gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams chos gsungs pa dang / ldem po dag gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa chos gsungs pa dang / thabs gang dang / tshul gang dang /
translated: They know the meaning and do not pursue the words. They know the expression by which the Tathāgatas teach the Dharma, the indirect expressions by which the Tathāgatas teach the Dharma, the methods, the ways,

original: snying rje chen po gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa chos ston par nges pa'i tshig brjod pa rab tu 'tshal to //
analyzed: snying rje chen po gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa chos ston par nges pa'i tshig brjod pa rab tu 'tshal to //
translated: and the great compassion by which the Tathāgatas teach the Dharma.”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: tshangs pa / byang chub sems dpa' gang la la de bzhin gshegs pa stobs lnga'i sbyor ba 'di shes na byang chub sems dpa' de ni sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pas sems can rnams la nye bar gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa / byang chub sems dpa' gang la la de bzhin gshegs pa stobs lnga'i sbyor ba 'di shes na byang chub sems dpa' de ni sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pas sems can rnams la nye bar gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: “Brahmā, if a bodhisattva knows this application of the five strengths of the Tathāgata, that bodhisattva is said to be present for the welfare of sentient beings through the activities of the Buddha.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs lnga'i sbyor ba gang lags /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs lnga'i sbyor ba gang lags /
translated: “Blessed One, what is the application of the five strengths of the Tathāgata?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Brahmā, the application of the five strengths of the Tathāgata is as follows.

original: chos smra ba dang / ldem po dag tu smra ba bstan pa dang / thabs kyi chos la mos par byed pa dang / tshul nye bar bstan pa dang / snying rje chen po'i rjes su 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: chos smra ba dang / ldem po dag tu smra ba bstan pa dang / thabs kyi chos la mos par byed pa dang / tshul nye bar bstan pa dang / snying rje chen po'i rjes su 'jug pa ste /
translated: teaching them the way, and engaging in great compassion.

original: tshangs pa / 'di dag ni gang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis ma yin par de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs lnga'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa / 'di dag ni gang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis ma yin par de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs lnga'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: Brahmā, these are the five powers of the Tathāgata, which are not shared in common with the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said, “Blessed One,

original: gsung ba gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa chos rnams gsungs /
analyzed: gsung ba gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa chos rnams gsungs /
translated: by what speech do the Tathāgatas teach the Dharma?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: tshangs pa / 'das @67a *//
analyzed: tshangs pa / 'das @67a *//
translated: “Brahmā,

original: ba smra ba dang / ma 'ongs pa smra ba dang / da ltar byung ba smra ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa smra ba dang / rnam par byang ba smra ba dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba smra ba dang / 'jig rten pa dang /
analyzed: ba smra ba dang / ma 'ongs pa smra ba dang / da ltar byung ba smra ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa smra ba dang / rnam par byang ba smra ba dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba smra ba dang / 'jig rten pa dang /
translated: the speech of the past, the speech of the future, the speech of the present, the speech of affliction, the speech of purification, the speech of virtue and nonvirtue, the speech of the mundane,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa smra ba dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med par smra ba dang / kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa smra ba dang / 'dus byas dang /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa smra ba dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med par smra ba dang / kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa smra ba dang / 'dus byas dang /
translated: They are the ones who speak of the supramundane, the defiled, the undefiled, the reprehensible, the irreproachable, the conditioned,

original: 'dus ma byas smra ba dang / bdag dang / sems can dang / srog dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag smra ba dang / thob pa mngon du byed pa smra ba dang / 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa smra ba ste /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas smra ba dang / bdag dang / sems can dang / srog dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag smra ba dang / thob pa mngon du byed pa smra ba dang / 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa smra ba ste /
translated: the unconditioned, the self, the sentient being, the life-force, the nourished being, the person, the individual, the attainment, and the manifestation of nirvāṇa.

original: tshangs pa / smra ba de dag kyang yongs su ma grub pa'i tshul gyis smra ba sgyu ma lta bur lta'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa / smra ba de dag kyang yongs su ma grub pa'i tshul gyis smra ba sgyu ma lta bur lta'o //
translated: Brahmā, these speakers should be seen as illusory, in the sense that they are not ultimately real.

original: med par mthong ba'i tshul gyis smra ba rmi lam lta bur blta'o //
analyzed: med par mthong ba'i tshul gyis smra ba rmi lam lta bur blta'o //
translated: They should be seen as dream-like, in the sense that they are seen as nonexistent.

original: nam mkha'i sgra skad kyi tshul gyis smra ba brag ca lta bur blta'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i sgra skad kyi tshul gyis smra ba brag ca lta bur blta'o //
translated: They should be seen as echoes, in the sense that they are like the sounds of the sky.

original: rkyen 'dus pa'i tshul gyis smra ba mig yor lta bur blta'o //
analyzed: rkyen 'dus pa'i tshul gyis smra ba mig yor lta bur blta'o //
translated: They should be seen as optical illusions, in the sense that they are a coming together of conditions.

original: rgyu mi 'pho ba'i tshul gyis smra ba gzugs brnyan lta bur blta'o //
analyzed: rgyu mi 'pho ba'i tshul gyis smra ba gzugs brnyan lta bur blta'o //
translated: One should see the one who speaks in the manner of the unchanging cause as being like a reflection.

original: phyin ci log tu mthong ba'i tshul gyis smra ba smig rgyu lta bur blta'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu mthong ba'i tshul gyis smra ba smig rgyu lta bur blta'o //
translated: One should see the one who speaks in the manner of seeing what is distorted as being like a mirage.

original: mi 'byung mi 'jig pa'i tshul gyis smra ba nam mkha' lta bur blta'o //
analyzed: mi 'byung mi 'jig pa'i tshul gyis smra ba nam mkha' lta bur blta'o //
translated: One should see the one who speaks in the manner of non-arising and non-destruction as being like space.

original: brjod du med pa'i tshul gyis smra ba smrar med par blta'o //
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i tshul gyis smra ba smrar med par blta'o //
translated: One should see the one who speaks in the manner of the inexpressible as being inexpressible.

original: tshangs pa / byang chub sems dpa' gang chos smra ba 'di shes na byang chub @67b sems dpa' de dag ni smra ba thams cad smra'ang chos gang la'ang mngon par mi chags so //
analyzed: tshangs pa / byang chub sems dpa' gang chos smra ba 'di shes na byang chub @67b sems dpa' de dag ni smra ba thams cad smra'ang chos gang la'ang mngon par mi chags so //
translated: Brahmā, if bodhisattvas know this way of speaking, then those bodhisattvas will speak all forms of speech without being attached to any phenomenon.

original: de mngon par ma chags pas ye shes thogs pa med pa'i spobs pa gang gis bskal pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du chos bshad kyang rgyun mi chad pa dang / smra ba thams cad kyang chos kyi dbyings dang tha mi dad par smra ba dang /
analyzed: de mngon par ma chags pas ye shes thogs pa med pa'i spobs pa gang gis bskal pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du chos bshad kyang rgyun mi chad pa dang / smra ba thams cad kyang chos kyi dbyings dang tha mi dad par smra ba dang /
translated: Because of that non-attachment, they will have unobstructed wisdom and eloquence, through which they will teach the Dharma for as many eons as there are grains of sand in the Ganges without interruption, and all their speech will be spoken without being separate from the realm of phenomena.

original: chos rnams kyi tha mi dad pa la'ang mngon par chags par mi 'gyur ba'i ye shes thogs pa med pa'i spobs pa thob bo //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi tha mi dad pa la'ang mngon par chags par mi 'gyur ba'i ye shes thogs pa med pa'i spobs pa thob bo //
translated: He attains unobstructed eloquence in the wisdom that does not cling to the non-differentiation of phenomena.

original: tshangs pa / de bzhin gshegs pas de ltar gsungs pas chos rnams brjod do //
analyzed: tshangs pa / de bzhin gshegs pas de ltar gsungs pas chos rnams brjod do //
translated: Brahmā, the Tathāgata teaches the Dharma by speaking in that way.

original: tshangs pa / de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa'i ldem po dag la mkhas pa khong du chud ce na /
analyzed: tshangs pa / de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa'i ldem po dag la mkhas pa khong du chud ce na /
translated: “Brahmā, how do bodhisattvas understand the Tathāgata’s indirect teachings?

original: tshangs pa / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa'ang rnam par byang bar ston /
analyzed: tshangs pa / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa'ang rnam par byang bar ston /
translated: Brahmā, the Tathāgata teaches that the afflictions are purified,

original: rnam par byang ba'ang kun nas nyon mongs par ston te /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'ang kun nas nyon mongs par ston te /
translated: and he teaches that purification is afflicted.

original: de las byang chub sems dpa' ldem po dag tu shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de las byang chub sems dpa' ldem po dag tu shes par bya'o //
translated: Bodhisattvas should understand indirect teachings in that way.

original: tshangs pa / de bzhin gshegs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa la rnam par byang bar ji ltar ston ce na /
analyzed: tshangs pa / de bzhin gshegs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa la rnam par byang bar ji ltar ston ce na /
translated: “Brahmā, how does the Tathāgata teach that the afflictions are purified?

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid rlom sems med pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam par byang bar ston to //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid rlom sems med pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam par byang bar ston to //
translated: He teaches that the essence of the afflictions is the absence of conceit, and thus he teaches that the afflictions are purified.

original: rnam par byang ba kun nas nyon mongs par ji ltar ston ce na /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba kun nas nyon mongs par ji ltar ston ce na /
translated: How does he teach that purification is the afflictions?

original: rnam par byang ba'i ngo bo nyid rlom sems med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i ngo bo nyid rlom sems med pa'i phyir te /
translated: The essence of purification is the absence of conceit.

original: de ltar rnam par byang ba kun nas nyon mongs par ston @68a *//
analyzed: de ltar rnam par byang ba kun nas nyon mongs par ston @68a *//
translated: Thus he teaches that purification is the afflictions.

original: to; ;tshangs pa /
analyzed: to; ;tshangs pa /
translated: Brahmā,

original: nga sbyin pas mya ngan las 'das par ston te /
analyzed: nga sbyin pas mya ngan las 'das par ston te /
translated: I teach that nirvāṇa is generosity.

original: de ni byis pa dag gis mi shes kyi de la byang chub sems dpa' ldem po dag la mkhas pa ni sbyin pa'ang phyi ma'i tshe /
analyzed: de ni byis pa dag gis mi shes kyi de la byang chub sems dpa' ldem po dag la mkhas pa ni sbyin pa'ang phyi ma'i tshe /
translated: The childish do not understand this, but the bodhisattvas, who are skilled in the indirect teachings, understand that generosity leads to great happiness in the future.

original: skyid pa chen por 'gyur yang 'di la chos gang yang 'pho ba med do //🔽mi 'pho bas na mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: skyid pa chen por 'gyur yang 'di la chos gang yang 'pho ba med do // mi 'pho bas na mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: But in this there is no transference of any phenomenon.🔽Since there is no transference, there is nirvāṇa.

original: mngon par 'du mi byed pa'i tshul gyis tshul khrims kyis mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'du mi byed pa'i tshul gyis tshul khrims kyis mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Nirvāṇa is ethical discipline, in that it is the absence of mental activity.

original: skad cig pa'i tshul gyis bzod pas mya ngan las 'das pa'o //🔽blang ba dang / dor ba med pa'i tshul gyis brtson 'grus kyis mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: skad cig pa'i tshul gyis bzod pas mya ngan las 'das pa'o // blang ba dang / dor ba med pa'i tshul gyis brtson 'grus kyis mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Nirvana is through patience in the manner of momentariness.🔽Nirvana is through effort in the manner of not accepting or rejecting.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i tshul gyis bsam gtan gyis mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i tshul gyis bsam gtan gyis mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Nirvana is through concentration in the manner of non-conceptuality.

original: thogs pa med pa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyis mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: thogs pa med pa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyis mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Nirvana is through wisdom in the manner of unobstructedness.

original: chos kyi dbyings 'dod chags dang bral bas na 'dod chags ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i mtha'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings 'dod chags dang bral bas na 'dod chags ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i mtha'o //
translated: Since the dharmadhatu is free from attachment, attachment is the extreme of freedom from attachment.

original: chos kyi dbyings la gtum pa med pas zhe sdang ni yang dag pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la gtum pa med pas zhe sdang ni yang dag pa'i mtha'o //
translated: Since the dharmadhatu is free from anger, anger is the extreme of reality.

original: chos rnams la rmongs pa med pa'i phyir gti mug ni gti mug med pa'i mtha'o //🔽shi 'pho med pa dang / skye ba med pa'i tshul gyis 'khor ba'ang mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams la rmongs pa med pa'i phyir gti mug ni gti mug med pa'i mtha'o // shi 'pho med pa dang / skye ba med pa'i tshul gyis 'khor ba'ang mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Since there is no delusion regarding phenomena, delusion is the extreme of non-delusion.🔽Samsara is nirvana in the manner of no death and no birth.

original: mngon par chags pa med pa'i tshul gyis mya ngan las 'das pa'ang 'khor ba'o //
analyzed: mngon par chags pa med pa'i tshul gyis mya ngan las 'das pa'ang 'khor ba'o //
translated: Nirvana is samsara in the manner of non-attachment.

original: tha snyad du 'dogs pa'i lta ba bden pa'ang rdzun pa'o //
analyzed: tha snyad du 'dogs pa'i lta ba bden pa'ang rdzun pa'o //
translated: The view that is conventionally designated as “true” is also false.

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal can rnams la ni rdzun @68b ba'ang bden pa'o zhes de ltar shes so //
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal can rnams la ni rdzun @68b ba'ang bden pa'o zhes de ltar shes so //
translated: For those who are arrogant, what is false is also true.

original: gzhan yang / tshangs pa /
analyzed: gzhan yang / tshangs pa /
translated: Brahmā,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni ldem po dag gi rnam grangs kyis bdag nyid rtag par smra bar zhal gyis bzhes so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni ldem po dag gi rnam grangs kyis bdag nyid rtag par smra bar zhal gyis bzhes so //
translated: the Tathāgata has accepted that he is permanent through the enumeration of his indirect teachings.

original: bdag nyid kun nas nyon mongs par smra ba dang / chad par smra ba dang / bya ba med par smra ba dang / log par smra ba dang / ma dad pa dang / byas pa mi gzo ba dang / mtshams gcod pa dang / skyug pa za ba dang /
analyzed: bdag nyid kun nas nyon mongs par smra ba dang / chad par smra ba dang / bya ba med par smra ba dang / log par smra ba dang / ma dad pa dang / byas pa mi gzo ba dang / mtshams gcod pa dang / skyug pa za ba dang /
translated: He has accepted that he is afflicted, that he is annihilated, that he is inactive, that he is false, that he is faithless, that he is ungrateful, that he is a boundary-crosser, that he is a regurgitator,

original: go skabs mi phyed par zhal gyis bzhes kyang de bzhin gshegs pa ni bshad pa 'di dag la mi 'byung mi snang ngo //
analyzed: go skabs mi phyed par zhal gyis bzhes kyang de bzhin gshegs pa ni bshad pa 'di dag la mi 'byung mi snang ngo //
translated: and that he does not give an opportunity. But the Tathāgata does not appear to have any of these qualities.

original: ldem po dag gang gis sems can rnams lhag pa'i nga rgyal 'dzin pa 'dor bar 'gyur ba'i ldem po dag de de bzhin gshegs pa ston te /
analyzed: ldem po dag gang gis sems can rnams lhag pa'i nga rgyal 'dzin pa 'dor bar 'gyur ba'i ldem po dag de de bzhin gshegs pa ston te /
translated: The Tathāgata teaches the indirect teachings in order to eliminate the pride of sentient beings.

original: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ldem po dag go /
analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ldem po dag go /
translated: This is the Tathāgata’s indirect teaching.

original: tshangs pa / de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa ldem po dag tu chos ston to //
analyzed: tshangs pa / de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa ldem po dag tu chos ston to //
translated: Brahmā, the Tathāgata teaches the Dharma through indirect teachings in this way.

original: de la byang chub sems dpas spyod pa la mkhas par blo dpyad par bya'o //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpas spyod pa la mkhas par blo dpyad par bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva should investigate the intellect in terms of skillfulness in practice.

original: de de ltar mthar phyin pas bstan pa thams cad la mkhas par 'gyur ro; ;de sems can rnams la gzugs kyi sku bstan pas sangs rgyas byung ngo snyam du mos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de de ltar mthar phyin pas bstan pa thams cad la mkhas par 'gyur ro; ;de sems can rnams la gzugs kyi sku bstan pas sangs rgyas byung ngo snyam du mos par 'gyur ro //
translated: By perfecting that, he becomes skilled in all the teachings. He thinks, ‘The Buddha has appeared because the form body is shown to sentient beings.’

original: chos kyi skus rab tu phye ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa ma byung ba'o zhes mos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos kyi skus rab tu phye ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa ma byung ba'o zhes mos par 'gyur ro //
translated: He thinks, ‘The Tathāgata has not appeared because of the Dharma body.’

original: yi ge rnam par rig pa lhur byed pa'i sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pas chos bstan to zhes mos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yi ge rnam par rig pa lhur byed pa'i sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pas chos bstan to zhes mos par 'gyur ro //
translated: He thinks, ‘The Tathāgata teaches the Dharma to sentient beings who are intent on the awareness of letters.’

original: chos nyid brjod du med par @69a *//
analyzed: chos nyid brjod du med par @69a *//
translated: The nature of phenomena is inexpressible.🔽

original: nges par byas nas chos bstan du med do zhes mos par 'gyur ro //🔽phyin ci log las byung ba'i nyon mongs pa yongs su mya ngan las bzla ba'i phyir yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa yod do zhes mos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nges par byas nas chos bstan du med do zhes mos par 'gyur ro // phyin ci log las byung ba'i nyon mongs pa yongs su mya ngan las bzla ba'i phyir yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa yod do zhes mos par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having ascertained that reality is inexpressible, they will believe that the Dharma is not taught.🔽In order to liberate from the afflictions that arise from error, they will believe that nirvāṇa exists.🔽In order to liberate from the afflictions that arise from non-error, they will believe that nirvāṇa does not exist.🔽In order to liberate from the afflictions that arise from the unborn, they will believe that nirvāṇa exists.

original: ma skyes pa'i chos rnams mi 'jig pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa med do zhes mos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i chos rnams mi 'jig pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa med do zhes mos par 'gyur ro //
translated: In order to liberate from the afflictions that arise from the indestructible, they will believe that nirvāṇa does not exist.

original: kun rdzob la 'jug pas sems can yod do zhes mos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob la 'jug pas sems can yod do zhes mos par 'gyur ro //
translated: In order to liberate from the afflictions that arise from the unborn, they will believe that nirvāṇa exists.🔽In order to liberate from the afflictions that arise from the indestructible, they will believe that nirvāṇa does not exist.🔽In order to liberate from the afflictions that arise from the unborn, they will believe that nirvāṇa exists.

original: don dam pa bstan pa sems can med do zhes mos par 'gyur te /
analyzed: don dam pa bstan pa sems can med do zhes mos par 'gyur te /
translated: In order to liberate from the afflictions that arise from the indestructible, they will believe that nirvāṇa does not exist.

original: tshangs pa / de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pas ldem po dag bstan pas chos ston to //
analyzed: tshangs pa / de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pas ldem po dag bstan pas chos ston to //
translated: Brahmā, in this way the Thus-Gone One teaches the Dharma through his indirect instructions.

original: de la byang chub sems dpas bstan pa thams cad la mi skrag par bya'o //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpas bstan pa thams cad la mi skrag par bya'o //
translated: Bodhisattvas should not be afraid of any of these teachings.

original: de la / tshangs pa /
analyzed: de la / tshangs pa /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thabs gang gis sems can rnams la chos ston ce na /

original: sbyin pas longs spyod 'thob pa dang / tshul khrims kyis mtho ris su skye ba dang / bzod pas gzugs bzang po 'thob pa dang / brtson 'grus kyis ye shes 'thob pa dang / bsam gtan gyis rab tu dben pa 'thob pa dang / shes rab kyis nyon mongs pa 'dor ba 'thob pa dang /

translated: Generosity leads to the attainment of wealth, discipline to rebirth in the higher realms, patience to the attainment of a beautiful form, diligence to the attainment of wisdom, meditative concentration to the attainment of solitude, and wisdom to the attainment of the relinquishment of defilements.

original: thos pas shes rab 'thob pa dang / dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam gyis mi dang / lha'i phun sum tshogs pa rnams 'thob pa dang / byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms kyis tshangs pa'i @69b 'jig rten du skye ba 'thob pa dang /

translated: Listening leads to the attainment of wisdom, and the ten virtuous actions lead to the attainment of the perfect human and divine existences, while love, compassion, joy, and equanimity lead to rebirth in the world of Brahmā.

original: zhi gnas kyis lhag mthong 'thob pa dang / slob pa'i sas mi slob pa'i sa thob pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sas sbyin pa yongs su sbyang ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi sas tshad med pa'i ye shes 'thob pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pas sdug bsngal thams cad nye bar zhi ba 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes /

original: byang chub sems dpa' de dag bsam gtan gyi dga' ba'i zas dang ldan par 'gyur ro //🔽bsam pa tsam gyis bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / bzhon pa dang / gos dang / 'chags dang skyed pos tshal dang / khang pa brtsegs pa @88a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de dag bsam gtan gyi dga' ba'i zas dang ldan par 'gyur ro // bsam pa tsam gyis bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / bzhon pa dang / gos dang / 'chags dang skyed pos tshal dang / khang pa brtsegs pa @88a *//
translated: Those bodhisattvas will have the food of the joy of meditation.

original: dang / 'bab chu dang / chu mig dang / mtsho dang / rdzing dang / lteng ga'i yongs su longs spyod pa thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dang / 'bab chu dang / chu mig dang / mtsho dang / rdzing dang / lteng ga'i yongs su longs spyod pa thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By merely wishing for it, all the enjoyments of food and drink, vehicles, clothing, parks, pleasure groves, palaces, waterfalls, springs, lakes, ponds, and pools will appear.

original: 'od srung / kun tu 'od rnam par 'phrul pa 'od zer gyi rgyal po de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de yi ge dang / nges pa'i tshig gis chos mi ston te /
analyzed: 'od srung / kun tu 'od rnam par 'phrul pa 'od zer gyi rgyal po de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de yi ge dang / nges pa'i tshig gis chos mi ston te /
translated: “Kāśyapa, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfect and Complete Buddha Samantaprabhāsa-vikūṇḍa-raśmi-rāja did not teach the Dharma through letters and definitions.

original: gzhan du na byang chub sems dpa' de dag de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od des reg ma thag tu mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa so sor thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na byang chub sems dpa' de dag de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od des reg ma thag tu mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa so sor thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Rather, as soon as those bodhisattvas were touched by the light of the Tathāgata, they attained the acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas.

original: 'od de sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzhan dag tu 'gro ba la thogs pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'od de sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzhan dag tu 'gro ba la thogs pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: That light will go to other buddha-fields without obstruction.

original: 'od des sems can gyi nyon mongs pa bsal ba la nyon mongs pa dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'od des sems can gyi nyon mongs pa bsal ba la nyon mongs pa dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: That light will remove the afflictions of sentient beings, and they will become free from afflictions.

original: yang / 'od srung /
analyzed: yang / 'od srung /
translated: Again, Kāśyapa,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de'i 'od las chos kyi tshul rab tu dbye ba'i sgra sum cu rtsa gnyis 'byung bar gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de'i 'od las chos kyi tshul rab tu dbye ba'i sgra sum cu rtsa gnyis 'byung bar gyur te /
translated: from the light of that Tathāgata, the sound of the thirty-two divisions of the Dharma way will emerge.

original: sum cu rtsa gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the thirty-two?

original: lta bar gyur pa yongs su dag pas chos thams cad stong pa'o //
analyzed: lta bar gyur pa yongs su dag pas chos thams cad stong pa'o //
translated: All phenomena are empty due to the purity of views.

original: rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang bral bas chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang bral bas chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa'o //
translated: All phenomena are signless due to being free from conceptualization and discrimination.

original: khams gsum las yang dag par 'das pas chos thams cad smon pa med pa'o //🔽rang bzhin gyis nye bar zhi bas chos thams cad 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: khams gsum las yang dag par 'das pas chos thams cad smon pa med pa'o // rang bzhin gyis nye bar zhi bas chos thams cad 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
translated: All phenomena are wishless due to transcending the three realms.🔽All phenomena are free from attachment due to being naturally peaceful.

original: smon pa med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis @88b chos thams cad zhe sdang dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: smon pa med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis @88b chos thams cad zhe sdang dang bral ba'o //
translated: All phenomena are free from aversion due to the characteristic of wishlessness.

original: mun pa mun nag dang bral bas chos thams cad gti mug dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: mun pa mun nag dang bral bas chos thams cad gti mug dang bral ba'o //
translated: Since it is free from darkness and obscurity, all phenomena are free from delusion.

original: thog ma nas ma skyes pas chos thams cad 'ong ba med pa'o //
analyzed: thog ma nas ma skyes pas chos thams cad 'ong ba med pa'o //
translated: Since they are unborn from the beginning, all phenomena are non-arising.

original: 'pho ba med pa'i tshul gyis chos thams cad 'gro ba med pa'o //
analyzed: 'pho ba med pa'i tshul gyis chos thams cad 'gro ba med pa'o //
translated: Since they are not transferred, all phenomena are non-departing.

original: rab tu mi brten pa'i phyir chos thams cad mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu mi brten pa'i phyir chos thams cad mi gnas pa'o //
translated: Since they are not well-established, all phenomena are non-abiding.

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba dang bral ba'i phyir chos thams cad dus gsum las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba dang bral ba'i phyir chos thams cad dus gsum las 'das pa'o //
translated: Since they are free from the past, future, and present, all phenomena transcend the three times.

original: rang bzhin gcig pa'i phyir chos thams cad bye brag med pa'o //🔽las kyi rnam par smin pa dang bral ba'i phyir chos thams cad ma skyes pa'o //🔽byed pa po mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad las dang / rnam par smin pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gcig pa'i phyir chos thams cad bye brag med pa'o // las kyi rnam par smin pa dang bral ba'i phyir chos thams cad ma skyes pa'o // byed pa po mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad las dang / rnam par smin pa med pa'o //
translated: Since they are of a single nature, all phenomena are undifferentiated.🔽Since they are free from the ripening of karma, all phenomena are unborn.🔽Since an agent is not observed, all phenomena are devoid of action and ripening.

original: mngon par 'du mi byed pa'i tshul gyis chos thams cad ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'du mi byed pa'i tshul gyis chos thams cad ma byas pa'o //
translated: Since they are not conditioned, all phenomena are uncreated.

original: mngon par 'du ma byas pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir chos thams cad mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'o //🔽skye ba dang / 'jig pa dang bral ba'i phyir chos thams cad 'dus ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'du ma byas pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir chos thams cad mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'o // skye ba dang / 'jig pa dang bral ba'i phyir chos thams cad 'dus ma byas pa'o //
translated: All phenomena are unconditioned because they are not differentiated by conditioning.🔽All phenomena are unconditioned because they are free from arising and destruction.

original: yang dag par ma byung ba'i phyir chos thams cad yang dag pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par ma byung ba'i phyir chos thams cad yang dag pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: All phenomena are unreal because they do not arise.

original: gcig car mngon par rtogs pa'i tshul gyis chos thams cad bden pa'o //
analyzed: gcig car mngon par rtogs pa'i tshul gyis chos thams cad bden pa'o //
translated: All phenomena are real because they are realized simultaneously.

original: sems can mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: sems can mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad bdag med pa'o //
translated: All phenomena are selfless because sentient beings are not observed.

original: don dam pa'i phyir chos thams cad gang zag med pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i phyir chos thams cad gang zag med pa'o //
translated: All phenomena are without person because of the ultimate.

original: shes par mi byed pa'i phyir chos thams cad sems @89a *//
analyzed: shes par mi byed pa'i phyir chos thams cad sems @89a *//
translated: All phenomena are without mind because they are not known.

original: pa'o // mdza' ba dang / khong khro ba med pa'i phyir chos thams cad btang snyoms pa'o //
analyzed: pa'o // mdza' ba dang / khong khro ba med pa'i phyir chos thams cad btang snyoms pa'o //
translated: All phenomena are equanimous because they are free from attachment and aversion.

original: yongs su gzung ba med pa'i phyir chos thams cad ci'ang med pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su gzung ba med pa'i phyir chos thams cad ci'ang med pa'o //
translated: All phenomena are nothing whatsoever because they are ungraspable.

original: rang bzhin gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir chos thams cad nye ba'i nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir chos thams cad nye ba'i nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
translated: All phenomena are free of secondary mental afflictions because they are by nature free of afflictions.

original: dben pa'i mtha' yin pa'i phyir chos thams cad tshul gcig pa'o //
analyzed: dben pa'i mtha' yin pa'i phyir chos thams cad tshul gcig pa'o //
translated: All phenomena are of one taste because they are the limit of reality.

original: dpen pa phun sum tshogs pas chos thams cad dben pa'o //
analyzed: dpen pa phun sum tshogs pas chos thams cad dben pa'o //
translated: All phenomena are isolated because they are endowed with isolation.

original: mi 'khrugs pa'i phyir chos thams cad yang dag pa'i mtha' la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'khrugs pa'i phyir chos thams cad yang dag pa'i mtha' la gnas pa'o //
translated: All phenomena abide in the limit of reality because they are unperturbed.

original: shin tu tha mi dad pa'i phyir chos thams cad de bzhin nyid la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu tha mi dad pa'i phyir chos thams cad de bzhin nyid la gnas pa'o //
translated: All phenomena abide in suchness because they are utterly undifferentiated.

original: thams cad du rjes su song ba'i phyir chos thams cad chos kyi dbyings su yang dag par 'du ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad du rjes su song ba'i phyir chos thams cad chos kyi dbyings su yang dag par 'du ba'o //
translated: All phenomena are subsumed within the realm of phenomena because they are all-pervading.

original: phan tshun mi 'du ba'i phyir chos thams cad rkyen med pa'o //
analyzed: phan tshun mi 'du ba'i phyir chos thams cad rkyen med pa'o //
translated: All phenomena are devoid of conditions because they do not mutually combine.

original: mnyam pa nyid kyis yongs su rgyas pa'i phyir chos thams cad rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyis yongs su rgyas pa'i phyir chos thams cad rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'o //
translated: All phenomena are dependently originated because they are pervaded by sameness.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du mthong bas phye ba'i phyir chos thams cad byang chub bo //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du mthong bas phye ba'i phyir chos thams cad byang chub bo //
translated: All phenomena are awakening because they are distinguished by seeing things as they are.

original: yongs su ma grub pa'i tshul gyis chos thams cad mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes /
analyzed: yongs su ma grub pa'i tshul gyis chos thams cad mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes /
translated: All phenomena are nirvāṇa in the manner of not being fully established.

original: 'od srung / de ltar bcom ldan 'das kun tu rnam par 'phrul pa 'od zer gyi rgyal po de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od de las 'di lta bu'i chos thams cad kyi tshul rab tu dbye ba'i phyir sgra sum cu rtsa gnyis 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'od srung / de ltar bcom ldan 'das kun tu rnam par 'phrul pa 'od zer gyi rgyal po de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od de las 'di lta bu'i chos thams cad kyi tshul rab tu dbye ba'i phyir sgra sum cu rtsa gnyis 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Kāśyapa, in that way, from the light of the Tathāgata King of the Radiance of Complete Emanations, these thirty-two sounds emerge in order to distinguish all phenomena.

original: @89b gnas brtan 'od srung chen pos gsol pa /
analyzed: @89b gnas brtan 'od srung chen pos gsol pa /
translated: The elder Mahākāśyapa said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: 'od zer des sangs rgyas kyis mdzad pa bgyid par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'od zer des sangs rgyas kyis mdzad pa bgyid par 'gyur ro //
translated: that light will perform the deeds of a buddha.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: 'od srung / de bzhin gshegs pa de tshe dpag tu med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'od srung / de bzhin gshegs pa de tshe dpag tu med par 'gyur ro //
translated: “Kāśyapa, the lifespan of that Tathāgata will be immeasurable.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de na bdud kyi las kyis bar du gcod pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de na bdud kyi las kyis bar du gcod pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that buddha realm, the deeds of Māra will be obstructed.

original: 'od srung chen pos gsol pa /
analyzed: 'od srung chen pos gsol pa /
translated: Mahākāśyapa said,🔽“Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das; sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su bzung bar 'tshal bas rigs kyi bu 'di'i rnam pa thams cad mchog dang ldan pa ji 'dra ba de lta bur yongs su dag pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su gzung bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das; sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su bzung bar 'tshal bas rigs kyi bu 'di'i rnam pa thams cad mchog dang ldan pa ji 'dra ba de lta bur yongs su dag pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su gzung bar bgyi'o //
translated: Blessed One, those who wish to take possession of a buddhafield should take possession of a pure buddhafield like that of this son of family, who is endowed with the most excellent of all aspects.”
